Prepare accurate financial statement for management reporting purpose; ensure all financial reports are complied with internal and external reporting requirements.
Prepare and ensure the accuracy of journal entries to maintain the corporation's account books if necessary.
Ensure all transaction entries are system-integrated to the proper G/L accounts; maintain all general ledger accounts on a regular basis including reconciling sub-ledgers with G/L accounts.
Maintain chart of accounts which entailed creating new accounts and remove out of date accounts.
Conduct reconciliation on company bank accounts on weekly/monthly basis; reconcile balance sheet items such as prepayment, deposit, other accruals, etc. monthly.
Perform on time year-end and month-end closing. This includes preparing all necessary closing entries such as accruals, depreciation, and any necessary adjustment entries.
Prepare balance sheets, profit and loss statements and other financial reports such as monthly cash low reports.
Monitor company assets register such as automobile, furniture and fixtures, computer hardware and software and the corporation's accounting files as needed.
Ensure company’s books of accounts and related matters are handled appropriately and the company’s accounting systems are maintained according to the company’s procedures.
Support in periodic audits, inventory physical count, prepare necessary documentation and any required information requested by auditors.
Reconcile inventory reports, identify and report any issues to management and liaise with other departments to resolve issues.
Assist in monitoring departmental budgets throughout the year and report any significant deviations to management with analysis detailing the cause for the deviation and corrective action(s) necessary.
Recommend solutions to any accounting related issues using accounting systems and procedures when necessary.
Liaison with company CPA for any tax-filing issues and provides all information requested.
Improve the efficiency in the workflow of accounting department.
Participate in weekly accounting meeting to point out problems and difficulties encountered and to provide solutions.
Prepare ad hoc reports to manager, controller, and CFO.
Any other ad-hoc duties as assigned

Minimum Degree in Accountancy or equivalent with CPA

Proficient in Microsoft Office
Experienced in Oracle R12 preferred

Roles & Responsibilities
PRODUCT AREA
Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
JOB DESCRIPTION
In this role, you will craft a story for customers looking to begin their journey with Google around API Security, App Integration, and manage API Platform offerings. You will be the subject matter expert on the Apigee family of products in the region and will partner with the Small/Medium Business (SMB) Sales team on qualifying and working with Apigee and App Integration customers. Develop and maintain technical and conversational proficiency in products including App Modernization, App Innovation and App Security scenarios.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in sales promoting SaaS based solutions.
Experience building relationships and operating in a cross-functional environment.
Ability to speak and write in English and Bahasa Indonesia fluently to engage and support Bahasa Indonesia-speaking customers to navigate industry standards.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Knowledge of cloud technology.
Ability to articulate the Google Cloud value proposition.
Ability to become an expert in API management.
Ability to grow in a fast-paced, changing, and ambiguous environment.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders internally and externally.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Purpose
The role is accountable for generating leads, adding new clients, business development and nurturing relationships with key BCO accounts within the region. This entails developing and executing key account strategies, developing long-term strategic relationships with BCOs and reporting on account performance to support DP World APAC in achieving its sales KPIs and business goals.
Key Accountabilities
Business Development and generating sales
Develop a deep understanding of the customer’s business and identify/explore commercial opportunities in the region.
Develop with Head of Commercial Logistics and execute sales strategies for key accounts managed, including developing business development targets (OKRs) budgeting and KPIs.
Build, manage and extend relationships with key BCOs in the region to achieve OKRs and KPIs.
Monitor performance of strategic plans and evaluate successes, risks and opportunities and formulate plans to address these.
Contribute to the formulation and implementation of DP World’s overall sales strategy for the region to enhance P&L.
Manage relationship across the logistics value chain (e.g., agents, shippers) within the region to guarantee a seamless customer experience.
Safety Accountabilities
Commit to compliance with applicable HSSE requirement in the responsible fields / department.
Allocate adequate resources to eliminate / reduce identified HSSE risks to as low as reasonably practicable, and supervise the HSSE enforcement to get the desire result.
Influence critical HSSE behaviour expectations by demonstrating role-Model in the responsible field / department.
Deliver HSSE KPIs cascaded to the responsible field / department.
Qualifications, Experience and Skills
Prefer candidates to come from carrier/logistics/freight forwarding background, already a KAM and can bring in with them their relationship with BCO and expertise in FMCG vertical.
Tertiary qualifications preferably in Business Administration, Shipping / Logistics Management or equivalent disciplines.
Minimum 8 years’ experience in sales / account management experience with a Freight Forwarding/Logistics company
Experience in freight-forwarding sales.
Experienced working in customer-centric environment (Agile experience is a plus).
Worked directly with BCOs, with proven track record of building and maintaining high quality, long-term relationships.
Excellent negotiation, communication and interpersonal skills.

description:

Roles & Responsibilities
This is an opportunity to join a leading SaaS company that works with government departments, agencies & the biggest brands across APAC, enabling them to understand what drives their customers.
As a Business Development Manager, you'll take charge of acquiring new business through the application of effective sales techniques. You'll be expected to develop and sustain awareness regarding the company’s products and services, as well as negotiate and close business contracts.
Other responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Executing strategic plans to meet and exceed growth sales targets.
Maintaining a healthy sales pipeline at all times by continually engaging new clients.
Setting the right expectations for clients and facilitating service trials if necessary.
Preparing and presenting written proposals and price quotations, making sure that all products and services are given equal sales attention.
Closing deals at appropriate price levels and completing all accreditation requirements imposed by the clients before hand-over to the account management team.
Assisting the account management team with initial client education and service information upon turnover if necessary.
Maintaining high standards in terms of personal sales discipline, work ethic and professionalism
Ensuring compliance with company policies and standards, and all local statutory requirements.
Qualifications:
A degree in media, communications, advertising, marketing or business.
Must have at least 5 years’ experience in sales, preferably in a B2B SaaS environment, corporate sales experience and knowledge of the market, current media issues, competitor behaviour and strategy. Exposure to marketing is also deemed desirable.
Excellent verbal and written English communication skills; ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organisation and with external parties to senior executive levels. Ability to speak in Chinese (Cantonese/Mandarin) or other local languages will be an added advantage.
Eager, tenacious, articulate, diplomatic, high energy, competitive and driven. Proven capability in hands-on problem solving, with the ability to generate ideas and solutions. Has a genuine interest in mass information, digital/traditional media and current events.
Microsoft office and G-suite competence, and has an understanding of various social media platforms.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Global Client Director at Fujifilm Business Innovation Asia Pacific is responsible for some of our largest and most strategic clients. The candidate develops high level relationships via a though leadership and strong consultative approach. An effective communicator with a blend of professional characteristics including presence in front of customers and relationship among peers.
As a trusted advisor, you will help clients in aligning their business goals with ours. You possess keen industry specific knowledge in identifying our clients’ business processes and operational model, experience in managing large muti-million document and digital transformation opportunities is highly desirable.
You lead in identifying and qualifying business opportunities in your accounts. Develop key penetration approach, competitive analysis and unique value proposition(s) and pursuit / bid resources required to secure the business. Drive strategy development, incorporating external and internal needs, for each pursuit. You will plan and executes your account strategy via a robust account management framework; often collaborating with various partners.
Responsible for working/aligning with internal teams, collaborating, and attending meetings on program and bid management, participate in account reviews, planning, and delivery related client escalations, and manage delivery standards. Ability to prioritize, multi-task, and perform effectively under pressure.
You must possess a proven track record in meeting revenue target via clearly defined key performance indicators, attain customer satisfaction, retention & loyalty. Excellent customer network with a good relationship matrix score.


The key roles and responsibilities:
Create Client Strategy – Develops effective strategies to drive profitable and sustainable growth. Maintain effective communication with various internal partners.
Execute Client Strategy – Responsible for implementing the strategic account strategy to maximize new service opportunities while acting as the client trusted advisor.
Trusted Advisor – Establishes position of business advisor as well as creating potential growth opportunities with client executives by demonstrating thought leadership and strategic thinking.
Business Value Communication– Responsible for communicating and leveraging the value delivered to expand the client relationship and increase the business growth opportunities.
Problem Solver – Grasp and analyse information, create business model / solution, and develop recommendations for client. Concise and meaningful presentation to client and internal stakeholder.
Lead Virtual Bid team(s) – Leads, motivates, and inspires virtual teams to successfully execute client strategies and tactics to maximize sales effectiveness and increase win rates. Follow established pursuit process and gain defined approvals.
Innovation - Seeks opportunities for different and innovative approaches to addressing problems and opportunities.
Interpersonal Skills - Establishes and maintains effective working relationships with people; successfully addresses conflicts and problems involving people
Achieve set portfolio/ account targets – including revenue, contracts signed, customer satisfaction and profitability. Responsible for to maximize operational excellence, drive profitable growth and minimize risk for FB.
To succeed in this role, the candidate should possess the following qualifications, skills and experience:
Bachelor’s degree and 10+ year experience working in an in a relevant industry (financial services, technology), driving digital transformation, or other relevant work experience (e.g., consulting, technology, start-up).
8+ years account management experience or equivalent.
A good network of ‘C’ and ‘D’ contacts with high relationship score.
Experience as strategic account lead for a large multinational company.
Proven record of securing multi-million-dollar deals.
Strong service and consultative based selling approach.
Superior engagement skill in managing lifecycle of complex sale and multiple client engagement
Demonstrated ability to motivate and manage team, as well as mentor / coach individuals in the team
Good sense of different cultural nuances and ability to bring various cultures together.
Willingness to travel at short notice.
Interested candidates who wish to apply for the advertised position, please click "Apply"

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Objectives of the position:

The Product Manager is responsible for design, development, implementation, and analysis of products. Performs routine engineering design tasks using standard techniques. Fair knowledge of
cable and components applications.

Key Responsibilities

• Planning and evaluating new projects, consulting with other engineers and management as necessary.
• Review new product plans and make recommendations for material selection, based on design objectives such as strength, weight, heat resistance, electrical conductivity, and cost.
• Work with account managers, sales, production and engineers to establish cost estimates and production standards.
• Identifies process bottlenecks and devises solutions to resolve.
• Prepare technical drawings to ensure that installation and operations conform to standards and customer requirements. Where applicable.
• Optimizes productivity in both the engineering and production areas by designing, implementing and testing new procedures.
• Contributes to the teams’ efforts by successfully completing related tasks as needed.

Skills & Qualification

• Analytical skills for troubleshooting designs that are not working as planned and finding answers that work by asking the right questions and testing options.
• Strong written and verbal communication skills to effectively explain details of the process and findings to groups of all skillsets.

title: Senior Facilities Manager / Area Manager

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Senior Facilities Manager shall be overall responsible for the performance of the Facilities Management Manager Services. The Area Manager will report direct to Account Manager and client on sites which he or she is assigned to.
This comprises the administration and management of the following work but shall not be limited to followings: -
1. Setting up records and maintenance systems including contract preliminaries as detailed in the contract
2. Routine servicing, maintenance, and replacement of parts of mechanical and electrical systems and Domestic Equipment as described in Schedule B; and of Building & Civil Engineering Components, and Facilities as defined in the Conditions of Contract of this Invitation to Tender.
3. Housekeeping services and custodial repairs and regular inspections of the buildings and mechanical and electrical systems.
4. Ensure routine maintenance of facilities system and other specialised equipment in the sites are carried out by Term Contractors.
5. All contingency Repairs.
6. Routine servicing, maintenance, and replacement of parts of Specialist Systems comprising M&E, lifts, burglar alarm systems and key holding Services by direct Contractors separately appointed by the Authority
7. Routine servicing of fire extinguisher and other works and Services of contracts called under bulk tenders by Government common Agencies
8. Infrastructure Improvement Works.
9. Vacant buildings and vacant sites
10. Assess and recommend monthly payment claims from the term contractors.
11. Reviewing the current Standard Operating Procedures (SOP); and submitting proposals, if necessary, for the approval by the Authority, for amendments and/or additional procedures in line with current Authority requirements and guidelines.
12. The Facility Management Manager shall be responsible for updating, maintaining, and keeping the latest updated copy of the SOP for the inspection and review by the Authority at any time during the Services Period.
13. The Facility Management Manager shall also ensure that his Building Manager and every member of the managing team are always contactable. To always enable easy and quick contact for urgent fault reports and work request, the Facility Management Manager shall update the Authority of any changes made to the contact information. These changes shall be reflected in the monthly management report.
14. Any other duties as shown for the scope of work for facilities management as per MA contract.
15. All other duties as and when assigned by the company.
Requirement
Degree in Facilities/ Building Management or equivalent discipline with minimum 3 years in a Senior / Facilities Manager capacity
Qualified Fire Safety Manager would be advantage
Experienced in working in facilities and Managing Agent environment preferred
Experience in managing Hard and Soft FM
Good communication skills
Able to work independently as well as a team
Cushman & Wakefield is committed to building a diverse and engaged workforce and supporting an inclusive environment where our employees can do their best work. We believe that embracing new perspectives helps us solve problems, create opportunities and develop new ideas. For more details on DEI, please visit our webpage at https://www.cushmanwakefield.com/en/about-us/diversity-equity-and-inclusion

Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
The Export Sales Manager reports to Sales Director. He/She is responsible for the overseas sales and commercial partnership for the distributor accounts under his/her portfolio. He/She is tasked to optimize value for the product through the distributor markets by building strong sales relationship, driving visibility and distribution excellence, monitoring sales progress, marketing execution and overall account management. He/She interacts with the distributors and develops close working relationship with Marketing, Service and SCM, thereby executing the different job functions relative to business operations. He/She is responsible for managing the Sales of the Export Markets as well as communicating the business direction from senior management effectively.

Key Responsibility :
Responsible for defining and achieving targeted sales Value and Volume, demonstrating Year on Year growth with all Markets under his portfolio.
Responsible for defining with the Distributor the various sales and marketing strategies through the operational business plan, a.k.a. Sales Calendar.
Identify new, re-evaluate and manage network of agents/distributors to maximize effectiveness and penetration in the market. Responsible for collating market insights on a timely basis (Weekly: Competitor activities and pricing point by model) (Monthly: Channel PSI reports to Sales Director)
Responsible for Initiating and implementing Sales Ideas and Campaigns in the distributor markets with full awareness of Sales Seasonality.
Responsible for organising Team Market visits/ Product Launch/ Training on a fixed time schedule, i.e. 2-3 times per calendar year per market.
Responsible for AR monitoring, with awareness of Sales Risk, and Channel Inventory Sell out RUN RATE
Responsible for organising Distributor RTM (Round table Meetings) bi annually with focus on sales and developmental growth in the Export markets.
Co-Responsible for Consumer Care in Export markets. Responsible for high level engagement in the Export Markets so as to Lead the Distributor in terms of market expansion and distribution coverage.

Job Requirements:
Candidate must possess at least Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Marketing/ Business Studies/Administration/Management, or equivalent.
Min 3 years of experience in Export Sales/ Marketing/Sales or relevant fields ( in AV, IT or fast moving electronic products) and have a good distributor management.
Excellent management skill in both internal/external relationship at multi-level
You are sales driven, with a high level of commercial acumen and a good overall understanding of consumer trends in the region.
Good management and achieve sales objectives independently
Able to multitask/ planning ability
Able to prioritize objectives and meet deadlines
Excellent Presentation skills
Effective communication and negotiation skills
Excellent Team Player
Able to travel

company: PROCTER & GAMBLE INTERNATIONAL OPERATIONS SA SINGAPORE BRANCH
company_info: We produce globally recognized brands and we grow the best business leaders in the industry. With a portfolio of trusted brands as diverse as ours, it is paramount our leaders are able to lead with courage the vast array of brands, categories and functions. We serve consumers around the world with one of the strongest portfolios of trusted, quality, leadership brands, including Always®, Ariel®, Gillette®, Head & Shoulders®, Herbal Essences®, Oral-B®, Pampers®, Pantene®, Tampax® and more. Our community includes operations in approximately 70 countries worldwide. Visit http://www.pg.com to know more. Our consumers are diverse and our talents - internally - mirror this diversity to best serve it. That is why we’re committed to building a winning culture based on Inclusion and our ideal candidate is passionate about the same principle: you will join our daily effort of being “in touch” so we craft brands and products to improve the lives of the world’s consumers now and in the future. We want you to inspire us with your unrivaled ideas.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Manager – Hiring for 2024
We are hiring for these functions via 2023 Internship Program: Brand Management, Business Analytics (IT), Consumer Market Knowledge, Customer Business Development (Sales), Data Science (IT), Finance & Accounting, Human Resources, and Product Supply.

Brand Management
As a Brand Manager, you are a catalyst to the brand’s strategic choices, product and commercial innovations, holistic communication plans and brand executions across all media and consumer touch point, leveraging data, insights, creativity, and innovation to achieve unparalleled product superiority.
From Day 1, you will be assigned full responsibility for your brand and business results, You are accountable for developing and executing strategies and plans in partnership with internal multidiscipline teams, external creative and communication agencies.
To be successful in this role, you will need strong passion and strength in consumer, customer and market understanding and insights to develop creative and innovative solutions that allow us to win in the marketplace.
Consumer Market Knowledge
Your role in CMK (Consumer Market Knowledge) is like an internal, active, and influential business strategy consultant, whose role it is to ensure that consumer and shopper analytics and insights are the foundations of our business strategy and execution.
You are part of a multi-functional business team, working closely with Brand Management, Finance, Sales, R&D, and others, constantly exploring new opportunities for business growth.
Your key to success will be your ability to build on and combine soft skills with analytical skills, and use integrative thinking to convey research findings to drive actions with your key business partners across levels and functions.
We believe people are endlessly fascinating and there’s always something new to discover. One day you could be exploring human decision making and how the brain works and another deep-diving into big data sets to spot patterns and create insights to shape P&G business strategies. You will be growing your skills day in and day out, as you will be connecting with internal and external specialists to explore new ways to learn and you will be exchanging your insights with the CMK family.
Customer Business Development (Sales)
A career in P&G Sales exposes you not only to the Sales function, but also to the rest of the company, giving you an opportunity to develop a broad and deep skill set. The function offers a fast-paced environment, with significant business responsibility from day one.
Through your career you will rotate among different assignments within the function, which will give you the opportunity to interface with customers and develop strategy and plans internally. Traditional roles within the function include Account Executive, Key Account Manager, Customer Team Leader, Market Strategy and Planning Manager, Category Manager. The function also sources talent for Country/Region Manager and Category Leader roles.
Through these diverse experiences, you will get a comprehensive understanding of the various dimensions of P&G's business operations. P&G Sales also provides global career path opportunities, where you will work in various parts of the world and on businesses that span multiple countrie
Finance & Accounting
A career in P&G Finance & Accounting exposes you to different parts of both the Finance function, as well as the rest of the company, giving you a tremendous opportunity to develop a broad and deep skill set. The kinds of assignments you will be rotated through could include:
Sales Finance
Manufacturing (PS) Finance
Global Business Unit (GBU) Finance
Accounting
Internal Controls
Taxation
Treasury
Mergers & Acquisitions etc.
Through these diverse experiences, you will get a comprehensive understanding of the various dimensions of P&G's business operations. P&G Finance also provides global career path opportunities, where you will work in various parts of the world and on businesses that span multiple countries.

Human Resources
A career in P&G Human Resources will provide the responsibility to deliver strategies that drive growth for the business and the organization. You'll partner business leaders and organizations to deliver results, organizational changes, innovation, and talent strategies. Your work might span across local or regional scopes and projects.
Lead organization culture building and drive employee engagement
Lead and support global and organization talent strategies and programs including talent acquisition, talent development, talent management
Provide HR guidance and support to leaders, managers and employees (e.g. policy guidance, performance management, salary planning, employee relations cases, onboarding)
Analyse HR data and create reports, analysis, training materials, communication materials, assets, toolkits or job aids in a timely and accurate manner
Lead or assist with HR innovations and process changes to the local or regional markets
Liaise with external stakeholders (e.g. government-related entities, external organisations, candidates, vendors, suppliers, visitors) while upholding P&G reputation and brand equity.
Execute daily HR activities to support smooth local or regional business operations, in line with global and local market laws and guidelines
Information Technology
1) Business Analytics
Business Analysts (BAs) at P&G are a specialist group belonging to the Analytics & Insight Department. BAs provides the expertise and deep understanding in data-driven analytics about consumer, retailers and market understanding and insight.
The core work is to identify and activate growth opportunities for our brands at country/ trade channels/ and specific retailers levels. We identify these big insights through outstanding analytics based on data and advanced analytic & statistical tools. Our analytics are a combination of insight and foresight. Business Analyst is to deliver P&G business goals by using data and analytics to derive impactful consumer and business insights.
2) Data Science
Data Scientist (DS) at P&G are a specialist group belonging to the Data Science & Analytics team in IT Department. DSs provide the technical expertise and data-driven insights about consumer, retailer and market.
We are seeking talents who have passion to lead and make things happen, analytical thinkers, problem solvers, and excellent communicators.
Product Supply
A career in P&G Product Supply exposes you to different parts of the P&G supply chain, as well as the rest of the company, giving you a tremendous opportunity to develop a broad and deep skill set. The kinds of assignments you will be rotated through range from planning across different parts of the supply chain, initiative design and delivery, manufacturing, engineering design and delivery, procurement, etc. Through these diverse experiences, you will get a comprehensive understanding of the various dimensions of P&G's business operations. P&G Supply Chain also provides global career path opportunities, where you will work in various parts of the world and on businesses that span multiple countries.

WHY TAKE P&G INTERNSHIP?
Work on a live, independent business project that YOU OWN, LEAD and EXECUTE
Experience a global corporate environment and work with a diverse, cross-cultural team
Get formal training & coaching from P&G’s Leadership and Functional Colleges
Experience being a P&Ger and present your project to senior leaders during your midpoint and final presentation
Get compensated for the work you deliver
Finally, the best fit interns have potential to receive a Job Offer from P&G for Fulltime Management Positions after they graduate
We are looking for penultimate year students from ALL faculties to apply to us. Come and learn more about P&G's different functions/departments. Interns who participate in our 2023 Internship Program and are qualified will be considered for full time positions in 2024. Salary will commensurate with experience.

Qualifications
A college degree (Bachelor’s or Master’s, preferably with some business focus)
Excellent visionary, strategic and courageous leadership skills
Strengths in strategic and analytical thinking
An ability to drive innovation and brand growth
Strong ability to communicate and team capabilities
Please apply directly via: https://www.pgcareers.com/search-jobs/Singapore

title: Partner Sales Manager, APJ
company: AMAZON WEB SERVICES SINGAPORE PRIVATE LIMITED
company_info: AMAZON WEB SERVICES SINGAPORE PRIVATE LIMITED is a provider of remote computing services (also called web services) that together make up a cloud computing platform that is provided over the internet by Amazon.com. The most popular and well known of these services are Amazon EC2 and Amazon S3. The services are promoted as being centred around providing a large computing capacity, potentially many servers that are much faster and cheaper than actually having ones own datacentre.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Would you like to be part of a team that is redefining the IT industry? Amazon Web Services is leading the next paradigm shift in computing and is looking for a dynamic results oriented candidate to join as the APJ Partner Sales Manager within our APJ Partner Sales Team focused on our customers. As the Partner Sales Manager within Amazon Web Services (AWS), you will have the exciting opportunity to help shape and deliver on a strategy to build mind share and broad use of Amazon’s utility computing web services (including Amazon S3, Amazon EC2, Amazon CloudFront, Amazon RDS) within the portfolio of partners and solution providers. Your broad responsibilities will include helping to define and execute against our partner strategy for the APJ to drive new customer launches for our customers in APJ by establishing business and technical relationships, and managing the day-to-day interactions with these organizations in order to build long-term business and marketing opportunities. The ideal candidate will possess both a business background that enables them to drive an engagement and interact at the CXO/VP level, as well as a technical background that enables them to easily interact with software developers and architects. They should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions.
Key job responsibilities
Serve as a key member of the APJ Partner team in helping to drive the overall AWS partner strategy.
Own and drive through from qualification to closure pipeline of partner originated and AWS originated opportunities to drive contribution to revenue growth for our customers.
Have a broad based understanding of cloud technologies.
Develop a group of committed partners including a plan to recruit, on-board, educate and measure them in APJ.
Develop and execute the strategic sales growth plans while working with key internal stakeholders (e.g. sales, marketing, legal, support, etc.).
Work with specific prospects/partners to develop the business value proposition for using our services and solutions for the specific prospects/partners; educate and enable them for using AWS solutions.
Establish the business development pipeline by engaging with prospects and key customers.
Prepare and give business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress against budgeted plan and any potential roadblocks to closing new customers.
Manage complex contract negotiations and serve as a liaison to the legal group.
Develop long-term strategic partnerships in support of the market strategy.
Handle ad-hoc incoming inquiries and qualify them as potential AWS partnerships and customer targets.
Basic qualifications
The right person will have a balance of technical and analytical background; possess extensive sales, Channels and/or business development experience. Other requirements include:
Degree/MBA in relevant disciplines with at least ten years of working knowledge of software development tech companies.
Extensive channel and alliance experience in APJ is an essential requirement to be successful in this role.
Strong verbal and written communications skills as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations.
Experience as an Account Manager or sales overlay role.
Preferred qualifications
Experience working within the software industry is highly desired, especially in the virtualization, cloud or software spaces.
Exposure to and experience is developing channel programs to deliver sustainable revenue.
Culturally aware and have good interpersonal skills; able to collaborate across different functional teams and internal stakeholders.
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

title: Assistant Project Manager / Project Executive
company_info: VIZZIO is a leading 3D EARTH & SPACE TECHNOLOGY Company based in Singapore, with clients regionally and globally. Vizzio has mapped 89 3D earth cities, covering more than 29.4 million square kilometers of land area. We aim to build the world’s largest 3D capture and virtualization ecosystem for objects, space, and cities. VIZZIO's planetary-scale "3D-Mapping” ability turns current satellite, aerial and geospatial data into a semantic, machine-readable database and photorealistic synthetic 3D WGS84 georeferenced environments for simulation, gaming, visualization, urban planning, smart city, ESG, security & defense applications. Our deep learning algorithms pre-process satellite imagery and other geospatial data sources and create 3D models out of flat satellite images, combining real-time ray-tracing and advanced graphics rendering engine to create a photorealistic 3-D world. Our AI-based real-time 3D reconstruction approach solves global pose alignment and obtains dense volumetric reconstructions from 2D satellite images at a level of quality and completeness that was previously only attainable with human intervention and expensive photogrammetry methods. Previously, city modeling and reality capture relied on manual, labor-intensive processes - spanning months or even years. We can now create detailed geo-specific, accurate, high-resolution 3D geographic models and terrains of cities in just a fraction of the time needed. We are on a mission to create a dimensionally-accurate, photorealistic digital twin of the entire Planet Earth, covering 10,298 cities. For more information, please visit https://www.vizzio.ai/
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:
We are seeking talented and motivated Assistant Project Manager/Project Executive with 1-3 years of experience in managing accounts and delivering software solutions and services to clients in China, the Middle East (including Abu Dhabi and Saudi Arabia), and Singapore. This is an exciting opportunity for individuals with strong project management skills and the ability to work in diverse cultural contexts to join our dynamic team.

Responsibilities:
1. Assist in managing client accounts and building strong relationships with key stakeholders in China, the Middle East (including Abu Dhabi and Saudi Arabia), and Singapore.
2. Coordinate and oversee the successful delivery of software solutions and services to clients in these regions, ensuring adherence to project timelines, budgets, and quality standards.
3. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, and QA engineers, to ensure seamless project execution and customer satisfaction.
4. Prepare project plans, schedules, and documentation, ensuring clarity of project goals, deliverables, and resource allocation.
5. Monitor project progress, identify risks and issues, and implement mitigation strategies to ensure project success.
6. Serve as a liaison between clients and internal teams, facilitating effective communication, understanding client requirements, and managing expectations.
7. Support in conducting market research and identifying business opportunities in China, the Middle East (including Abu Dhabi and Saudi Arabia), and Singapore.
8. Stay updated with industry trends and emerging technologies, providing insights and recommendations to enhance project delivery and customer satisfaction.

Requirements:
i) Tertiary qualification in a relevant field such as computer science, business administration or marketing.
ii) 1-3 years of experience in project management, account management, or a related role, preferably in delivering software solutions and services to clients in China, the Middle East (including Abu Dhabi and Saudi Arabia), and Singapore.
iii) Proficiency in languages spoken and understood in these regions, such as Mandarin Chinese, Arabic, or other local languages.
iv) Strong project management skills, including planning, organizing, and coordinating multiple projects simultaneously.
v) Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with clients and internal teams across different cultures and time zones.
vi) Knowledge of software development lifecycle (SDLC) and experience working with development teams to deliver software solutions.
vii) Familiarity with agile project management methodologies and tools.
viii) Proactive problem-solving abilities and the capability to adapt to changing project requirements and priorities.
Preferred Qualifications:
a) Experience working with clients in China, the Middle East (including Abu Dhabi and Saudi Arabia), and Singapore.
b) PMP (Project Management Professional) certification or other relevant certifications in project management is advantageous.
c) Familiarity with software development technologies and frameworks.
d) Knowledge of the local business culture and practices in these regions.
e) Previous experience in the IT or software industry.

We offer a stimulating work environment where innovation, teamwork, and customer satisfaction are valued. If you have the required experience, language proficiency, and a passion for project management, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your resume and any additional documents showcasing your experience and language proficiency for consideration.

We look forward to the opportunity to discuss your qualifications and potential fit for our team.

title: Telesales Team Manager (Salary up to $5K) - CODE: GL
company_info: JUST RECRUIT SINGAPORE PTE. LTD. Just Recruit Singapore Pte Ltd is a human resource solution company that is incorporated in Singapore. We specialize in local and foreign placement. As we have counterparts in Malaysia, China, Taiwan, India, Vietnam & Korea and other parts of Asia, this make our networks very extensive and reliable. Our comprehensive range of services include temporary & contract staffing, permanent recruitment, outsourcing, executive search, leadership development, career management & outplacement services. Just Recruit Singapore Specialization: Semiconductor / Electrical & Electronics-Design, Testing, Development Engineers, Sales & Sales support etc. Oil & Gas/Petroleum –Process, Project, QC Chemical/ Petrochemicals-Sales, Engineers Banking & Finance – Accounts, Audit, Financial Consultant IT – Security Audit, Software/App Developer, Analyst, DBA Manufacturing- Production, Facility, Sales, Customer Service Building- QS, QC/QA, Piping Design, Architecture Logistics- Supply Chain, Sales, Backend Support Healthcare- Lab Assistants, R & D, Nurse, Dental Assistant(Foreign only) FMCG- Sales & Marketing, Customer Service, Facility, Product Dev. Retail –Retail Assistant, Area Manager Industry Specific Office Support roles: HR (all spectrum), Admin, Customer Service etc
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As a Telesales Team Manager, you will lead and manage a sales team of General Insurance Specialist to achieve and exceed the Targets through effective team management. You hold a key position in developing and coaching of a sales team to help them meet and exceed account management and retention goals by motivation and demonstration. Success in this role directly impacts the growth and development of the team while helping to fuel the continued success of the organization.

Job Details:
Salary ranges from $4k to $5K (Depends on experience and track record of sales) + VB
Working Location: East
Working days & hours: Mon to Fri / Office Hour
Permanent Role
Job Responsibilities:
Manage the day-to-day operations of the sales team
Provide the team with sales techniques coaching to ensure conformity to sales presentation standards, and sales opportunities are fully maximized
Track team sales results, conduct performance review and document improvement plan to upkeep sales performance and service professionalism
Analyze various KPIs and results to come up with the initiatives in further improving sales performance for individual members in your team
Lead, inspire and mentor the team to create motivated and engaged team, to build with a high performing and cohesive team spirit
Co-ordinate with various stakeholders within and other departments to achieve business goals and operational efficiency
Handle 1st level complaint escalated by the team and provide resolution
Live calls monitoring to ensure accurate product information, and team meeting all the customer satisfaction
Work closely with QA team to drive consistent high-quality services & counsel individual on service lapse and sales quality issues
Requirements:
Experience in insurance industry with relevant insurance qualifications, i.e. BCP, PGI, HI, preferably M5 & M9
Strong leadership with team leader experience in insurance industry to lead the Outbound team to achieve the set sales target
Interested candidates can kindly apply via MyCareersFuture or email your resume to gary.lua@justrecruit.com.sg

Gary Lua Zhi Hao (R21104006)
Just Recruit Singapore Pte Ltd (EA12C6295)

title: International Relationship Manager
company_info: Singapore Standard Chartered Bank in Singapore is part of an international banking group, with more than 150 years of history in some of the world’s most dynamic markets. Our purpose is to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, and our heritage and values are expressed in our brand promise, Here for good. The Bank has a history of over 160 years in Singapore, where we opened our first branch in 1859. In October 1999, we were among the first international banks to receive a Qualifying Full Bank (QFB) licence, an endorsement of the Group’s longstanding commitment to our business in the country. Singapore is home to the majority of our global business leadership, our technology operations, as well as SC Ventures, our innovation hub. In 2013, the Bank transferred our Singapore Retail and SME businesses to a locally incorporated subsidiary, Standard Chartered Bank (Singapore) Limited (“SCBSL”). And in May 2019, we fully consolidated our business operations in Singapore through the transfer of our Commercial Banking, Corporate & Institutional Banking and Private Banking businesses to SCBSL. SCBSL is one of the highest-rated banks globally: A1/Stable by Moody’s Investor Services, A/Stable by Standard & Poor’s and A+/Stable by Fitch Ratings. In August 2020, we were the first and only bank to be awarded the “Significantly Rooted Foreign Bank” (SRFB) status by the Monetary Authority of Singapore. In December 2020, we were granted enhanced SRFB privileges, in recognition of the significantly higher degree of rootedness exceeding the SRFB baseline criteria.
address: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 8 MARINA BOULEVARD 018981
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
This role is part of the Global Talent Mobility Program. The program offers a unique opportunity for Priority RMs who are looking to take their careers to next level by gaining global exposure and expanding their skills. The program will be launched across international wealth hubs and corridor markets. 3 hubs identified for the program are UAE, Singapore, and Hong Kong.
The program provides ample support and guidance to help the RM's settle and perform in the new market.
The Role Responsibilities
· Maximize new business/acquisition/referral opportunities and deepening existing customer relationships to the specified service standards for the Korea markets.
Implementation and oversight of the below individual responsibilities:
· To conduct a professional, consultative financial analysis and profiling session with customers to meet their financial needs/objectives.
· To foster and deepen customer relationships by providing regular market information updates and trend analysis on local and international financial products.
· In consultation with the PB team manager/ branch manager/ PTL, draw up monthly plans for achieving/exceeding sales targets to meet new business and customer acquisition goals
· To participate in marketing and promotional activities for customer acquisition.
· To source and call on individual prospects
· To provide quality, efficient after-sales services
· To manage anti-attrition and retention of clients
· To organise and conduct sales presentations to groups, clubs, associations, companies and other organisations.
· To solicit referrals from other parts of SCB eg. RMs from C&I, staff, etc.
· To comply with all applicable money laundering prevention procedures and in particular, report any suspicious activity to the Transaction Monitoring Unit.
· To ensure compliance with all regulations and controls as set by the Bank and external regulatory authorities.
Key Measurables
· Agreed individual sales target
· Agreed service standards to customers
· Operation control and sales compliance
Regulatory & Business Conduct
· Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group’s Values and Code of Conduct.
· Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.
· Lead the team to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank’s Conduct Principles. Fair Outcomes for Clients; Effective Financial Markets; Financial Crime Compliance; The Right Environment.
· Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.
Our Ideal Candidate
· 4+ years in Client Acquisition Experience
· Region Specific Client Networks & Experience
· Understands the core concepts, principles, processes or procedures of Wealth Management and Banking
· Good understanding and command of Mandarin as the incumbent will be supporting Chinese market
· CMFAS Certification
Role Specific Technical Competencies
· Client Acquisition Experience
· Account Management (of HNW Individuals) Experience
· Region Specific Language Expertise
· Region Specific Client Networks & Experience
· Technical knowledge and expertise in consumer banking products (i.e. Treasury, Equities, Funds, Insurance, etc.)
· Cluster Sales Management
· Cluster Customer Sales Experience
About Standard Chartered
We're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 160 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. We question the status quo, love a challenge and enjoy finding new opportunities to grow and do better than before. If you're looking for a career with purpose and you want to work for a bank making a difference, we want to hear from you. You can count on us to celebrate your unique talents. And we can't wait to see the talents you can bring us.
Our purpose, to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, together with our brand promise, to be here for good are achieved by how we each live our valued behaviours. When you work with us, you'll see how we value difference and advocate inclusion. Together we:
· Do the right thing and are assertive, challenge one another, and live with integrity, while putting the client at the heart of what we do
· Never settle, continuously striving to improve and innovate, keeping things simple and learning from doing well, and not so well
· Be better together, we can be ourselves, be inclusive, see more good in others, and work collectively to build for the long term
In line with our Fair Pay Charter, we offer a competitive salary and benefits to support your mental, physical, financial and social wellbeing.
· Core bank funding for retirement savings, medical and life insurance, with flexible and voluntary benefits available in some locations
· Time-off including annual, parental/maternity (20 weeks), sabbatical (12 weeks maximum) and volunteering leave (3 days), along with minimum global standards for annual and public holiday, which is combined to 30 days minimum
· Flexible working options based around home and office locations, with flexible working patterns
· Proactive wellbeing support through Unmind, a market-leading digital wellbeing platform, development courses for resilience and other human skills, global Employee Assistance Programme, sick leave, mental health first-aiders and all sorts of self-help toolkits
· A continuous learning culture to support your growth, with opportunities to reskill and upskill and access to physical, virtual and digital learning
· Being part of an inclusive and values driven organisation, one that embraces and celebrates our unique diversity, across our teams, business functions and geographies - everyone feels respected and can realise their full potential.
Recruitment assessments - some of our roles use assessments to help us understand how suitable you are for the role you've applied to. If you are invited to take an assessment, this is great news. It means your application has progressed to an important stage of our recruitment process.
Visit our careers website www.sc.com/careers

title: Assistant Manager, Regional Credit Risk, Consumer Lending
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Life at Grab
At Grab, every Grabber is guided by The Grab Way, which spells out our mission, how we believe we can achieve it, and our operating principles - the 4Hs: Heart, Hunger, Honour and Humility. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we work to create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia

Get to know our Team

The rapidly expanding Regional Credit Risk department at GrabFin (Financial Services segment) develops and launches credit products across multiple countries in SouthEast Asia.
The position is within the core credit risk team that drives the credit risk strategy of Grab’s Buy-Now-Pay-Later and consumer loan portfolios. The role is expected to own and play a critical role in building the product from scratch and in scaling the business across markets, this includes developing the backend (Credit Decision engine), the front-end (Limit Management), risk strategies via data science models, and creating a local setup in each country with scalable risk management and portfolio management solutions.
The Lending team is made up of a mix of professionals from risk management, product, design, consultants and software professionals, providing lots of opportunity to share knowledge and learnings across functions.

Get to know the Role

The Manager for Regional Credit Risk in consumer lending is responsible for managing, overseeing, and driving credit risk management strategies, policies, and procedures. This role offers a unique opportunity for rapid professional growth, encompassing all aspects of the credit risk framework, from data integrity to system reporting. The individual will be involved in designing underwriting and account management strategies for the consumer portfolio and will work closely with the vertical/ functional heads, country risk teams, and other functional stakeholders to execute them.

The Day-to-Day Activities

The role will be responsible for combining advanced analytics with strategic foresight to optimize our credit risk strategy, operations, ensuring sustainable growth and steadfast compliance in a dynamic financial landscape
Optimize underwriting and portfolio management risk policies through use of analytics and strategies for consumers and driver portfolios.
Understand, implement, and promote best lending practices in the across 6 different markets, ensuring successful acquisition and portfolio management strategies are integrated.
Continuously monitor portfolio risk reports, leveraging them to pinpoint and capitalize on opportunities for enhancing credit program efficiency.
Regularly provide ad-hoc credit risk evaluations and advisory to Regional teams, Group Risk Head, and other key stakeholders.
Assist in product and credit program development, reviewing and estimating risk parameters, product pricing, structure, and ensuring regulatory compliance.
Drive business agenda with potential partners, ensuring optimal risk and profitability economics.
The Must-Haves
A Master’s/Bachelor’s degree in a related domain, preferably in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics.
Minimum of 7+ years in roles such as Credit Underwriting, MIS Reporting, Credit Policy, or Credit Analytics; preferably with managerial experience of at least 1+ year.
Strong analytical skills with a capacity to collect, organize, and analyze vast amounts of data with meticulous attention to detail.
Comprehensive understanding of the retail banking customer credit life cycle, including origination and portfolio management; with prior experience in consumer lending (preferably credit cards/ personal loans/ Buy now pay later).
Self-driven, independent learner with a keen interest in team collaboration.
Detail-oriented and efficient time manager who thrives in a rapidly changing and dynamic working environment.
Demonstrated proficiency in verbal and written communication.
Prior hands-on experience with Python will be a distinct advantage.
The Nice-to-Haves
Advanced technical expertise concerning credit risk models, database management, and segmentation techniques.
Proficiency in English.
Our Commitment
We are committed to building diverse teams and creating an inclusive workplace that enables all Grabbers to perform at their best, regardless of nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity or sexual orientation and other attributes that make each Grabber unique.

title: Senior Strategic Alliance and Marketing Manager
company_info: MSD PHARMA (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD. Today’s MSD is a global healthcare leader working to help the world be well. MSD is a tradename of Merck & Co., Inc., with headquarters in Whitehouse Station, N.J., U.S.A. Through our prescription medicines, vaccines, biologic therapies, and consumer care and animal health products, we work with customers and operate in more than 140 countries to deliver innovative health solutions. We also demonstrate our commitment to increasing access to healthcare through far-reaching policies, programs and partnerships. Whatever your career path – whether it’s pursuing original science in the laboratory, working directly with our customers, manufacturing quality products or supporting our business in another way – MSD offers opportunities to develop and expand your career while making a true difference in people’s lives. Learn more about who we are as a company and to discover the many reasons to join MSD.
job_category: Consulting, Environment / Health, General Management, Healthcare / Pharmaceutical, Medical / Therapy Services
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Your opportunity to join a multi-award-winning leading biopharmaceutical company and be part of the best in class marketing team
Bring your entrepreneurial curiosity and learning spirit into a career of purpose and personal growth
You will engage with key stakeholders and commercial leaders, providing critical insights to help shape the best business outcome, aligned with overall business objectives and in line with operational requirements
Our Oncology team is dedicated to delivering breakthrough innovations that extend and improve the lives of cancer patients worldwide. Our team of forward-thinking individuals achieve this through an unwavering commitment to support accessibility to medicine, providing new therapeutic solutions, and collaborating with governments and payers to ensure that people who need medicines have access to them. Our focus is on innovation and launch execution excellence; we translate breakthrough science into innovative medicines that help people with cancer across the globe.
Our Marketing team are passionate about bringing our medicines and vaccines to our customers around the world. Through digital listening and patient analytics, we are able to understand our customers’ needs and strive to provide solutions to meet them.
What will you do:
Alliance partnerships (40%):
Enhance strategic relationship with alliance partners and stakeholders.
Lead the development of alliance brand strategic planning, coordination and execution of commercial activities and key performance metrics.
Foster an optimal cross functional team collaboration to optimize the alliance business.
Business innovation/ development overall Oncology (60%):
Develop overall pan tumour plan and market development strategies to grow the overall oncology business in Singapore.
Work closely with the sales and marketing team to understand where opportunities are the most appropriate to grow, protect or optimize the business.
Actively drives identification of opportunities within Singapore and Brunei Market.
Lead commercial innovations programs from end to end in terms of identification of opportunities, business case proposal, evaluation, and implementation.
Support strategic account manager in Brunei to realize the growth ambition of oncology in Brunei by providing marketing support in terms of communication materials and activities, stocks forecasting and management.
Manage marketing operation for in-line product range.
Keep abreast with the evolving healthcare industry trends, policy trends and scientific advancement of the oncology space.
Accountabilities/ KPIs:
Financial objectives of alliance brands
Perform regular country reviews, alliance reporting, monitors market trends, customer insights, competitor activities, and support sales force effectiveness, to identify and capture potential opportunities and address potential issues.
KPI monitoring meeting
Marketing planning, marketing material development & review, and forecasting
Work closely with local governance lead and regional steering committee to maximize synergies in alliance partnership.
Achieve the overall oncology business ambition (in terms of both financial goals and impact on oncology patients) for both Singapore and Brunei.
Support BUD in overall pan tumour financial forecasting.
Business case development, presentation, execution and evaluation for identified opportunities.
Forecasting accuracy and stock management for in line brands and Brunei key oncology products.
What should you have:
7 to 10 years' relevant industry experience in sales and marketing, with experience in a sales & marketing role.
Relevant Bachelor's degree qualification or higher in life sciences, pharmacy or related subjects.
Oncology sales & marketing experience
Alliance partnership management experience
Business development experience.
Strong customer focus including the desire to understand customer's needs and tailor appropriate solutions.
Demonstrated successful commercial track record.
Strategic leadership skills and vision
Effective communication
We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another’s thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.

Who we are …
We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.

What we look for …
Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us—and start making your impact today.

title: Account Manager
company_info: Anacle Systems Limited Established in 2006 and based in Singapore, we provide enterprise application software and energy management system to a strong and diversified customer and end-user base across Singapore, Malaysia, Taiwan, Qatar, UAE, and other Asian countries. Through technological innovations, we have been introducing products with a mission to empower enterprises to improve their business efficiency. Our Solutions Step into a world of innovation. Welcome to Anacle. We understand that your business is always evolving, as are your challenges – as are our solutions. Our core expertise lies in constant innovation, and deep domain knowledge in key growth market verticals to address the needs of our clients. Our expertise is in technology, but our focus is on your business. Our solutions are intuitive and user-friendly, simplifying workflow for the true centre of innovation – the people in your organization. To achieve these ends, Starlight®, a one-stop energy management solution and Simplicity®, a self-developed enterprise application software solution, were created under the umbrella of Anacle. Step into the ever-evolving world of Anacle, where solutions are always a step ahead of business challenges.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
Be the primary point of contact and build long-term relationships with customers
Help customers through email, phone, online presentations, screen-share and in person meetings
Develop a trusted advisor relationship with key accounts, customer stakeholders and executive sponsors
Ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to customer needs and objectives
Communicate clearly the progress of monthly/quarterly initiatives to internal and external stakeholders

title: Specialist, Account Manager
company_info: SERVICESOURCE INTERNATIONAL SINGAPORE PTE. LTD.
address: Mapletree Business City 2, 80 Pasir Panjang Road 117372
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Reporting to the Sales Director, the Account Manager is responsible for overseeing the management of highly complex B2B Enterprise Accounts. Serves an assigned territory/client, you will device and develop processes to ensure favourable relationships with clients, meeting the sales and operational needs. In this role, you will be managing the client’s customers end-to-end sales lifecycle, by renewing, expanding, and converting the service relationships our clients have with their existing customer base.

Successful candidates are independent and results-driven individuals that are excited to drive success through persuasion process and explore various sales channels to improve sales performance. Along the way you will have access to world-class training opportunities to grow and enhance your skills and career. At Concentrix, you can truly Own Your Future!
Job Description
Key Responsibilities
Ensure that client's customers are satisfied with our client's services and resolve escalated issues.
Achieve revenue-based quotas based on successful management of client accounts and supporting processes to meet operational needs and growth goals.
Evaluate our client's customer needs and propose potential solutions.
Service as a single point of contact for our client's customer.
Use data to remediate customer concerns/roadblocks prohibiting performance satisfaction.
Manage external competitive pressures and handle objections.
Work with multiple partners, building relationships with decision-makers at all levels.
Manage sales territory and achieve monthly quotas.
Negotiate in tough situations, help influence buying/renewal process using business analytics data.
Identify risk and barriers to success; develop contingency plans.
Identify opportunities for additional product or service sales.
Competencies
Bachelor’s Degree is preferred.
5 years of account management/ consultative-based sales experience managing Enterprise portfolio.
Experience with high-volume calling with proven track record of sales or account management in IT industry.
Experience with customer experience and sales, able to listen and respond to consumer needs, effectively communicate features and benefits of highly innovative products to customers.
Enthusiasm for new technology, demonstrate ability to extract hidden or unrealized requirements and gain consensus on these requirements with the customer.
Aptitude to learn and optimize new technology with prior experience in utilizing Client Relationship Management tool, i.e. Salesforce, SAP etc.
Advanced problem solving and analytical skill, demonstrate ability to multi-task and make timely and sound decisions under conditions of uncertainty or limited data.
Agility to manage ambiguous and complex situations, while maintaining good rapport with customers.

title: Account Manager (Coffee)
company_info: PPP Coffee aspires to be an organisation that reflects the close communities that our product brings together and serves. We believe that in addition to hiring the right talent, having the right values and mindsets, can lead the organisation in the right direction for specialty coffee. PPP Coffee’s employees for that matter, are the driving force of the organisation. Our business exists with the following in mind : offering a product or solution, running operations and consolidating our financial position. Yet, this is always underpinned by its people and technology. While coffee as a crop and commodity remains the same, the perception of what coffee can be, has been and will continue to be evolving. We're looking for people who bring fresh ideas from all areas, and work with a collaborative mindset in achieving a collective effort. Whatever your position here, we seek your contribution in taking the initiative and speaking out. PPP Coffee will always be a coffee company at heart. We hire a diverse range of people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to make however small a difference, in the world of specialty coffee. With coffee being pervasive in all cultures, countries, languages, social classes - we seek to bring communities closer together, by connecting people with coffee. While we aim to make better coffee, we also aim to make coffee better.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
PPP Coffee is looking for an experienced account manager to be part of its sales and marketing team. In this role, you will be responsible for growing our commercial/wholesale business in Singapore through acquiring new business account and maintaining relationships with our existing clientele, mainly (but not limited to) within the hotels, restaurants and cafes (“HORECA”) and offices territory.

Your job includes, but is not limited to the following:
Manage a portfolio of HORECA and corporate clients including retention, development and growth.
Provide professional and timely advice to our business account for queries relating to the wholesale business/products, working in close coordination with relevant departments.
Conduct basic coffee training for wholesale clients.
Onboard new client accounts and conduct 90-day check-ins and annual reviews.
Follow up on new leads and develop new business opportunities.
Cross-sell products and/or services across the PPP Coffee Group to new and/or existing clients.
Prepare sales proposals and assist with coffee tastings and client presentations.
Meet or exceed set goals for sales and performance, working both independently and within a team.
Participate in tradeshows and/or networking events as required.
Requirements
1-3 years of experience in an account management role in an FMCG or F&B environment
Experience or knowledge in specialty coffee and/or coffee machines
Good written and spoken English
Basic Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint skills
Ability to communicate well with diverse groups; multi-task and perform well in a fast-paced environment
Good interpersonal and organisational skills

Benefits
Up to 19 Days Annual Leave + Birthday Leave
Free non-alcoholic beverages
Staff discounts
Complimentary monthly movie tickets
Medical and grooming benefits
10 mins walk away from Bendemeer / Lavender MRT

title: Accounts Manager
company_info: Established in 1997, Office Planner (OP) is the first Singapore and Asian-owned office furniture manufacturer to be Eco-label certified by GECA. The prestigious Eco-label is awarded to companies that meet or exceed voluntary standards of environment performance. On top of its Eco-label recognition, Office Planner's green label drive has propelled them to seek Eco-Office certification from Singapore Environment Council (SEC) as well as Greenmark Interior Gold award from BCA. OP's range of office furniture meets international standards: ANSI/BIFMA X5, and has also attained Ergonomic certification, SS.541 from PSB Singapore. A company is no longer just about how it looks but how it maximises its "happiness quotient" for its staff and minimises materials to keep even the environment smiling.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibility
Financial Reporting:
· Prepare and analyze financial statements, including income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements.
· Generate financial reports for management, shareholders, and external stakeholders.
· Ensure compliance with accounting standards and regulations.
Budgeting and Forecasting:
· Develop and manage budgets for various departments or projects.
· Forecast future financial trends and provide recommendations based on analysis.
Full Sets of Accounts:
· Take responsibility for maintaining the full set of accounts, which includes General Ledger (GL), Accounts Payable (AP), Accounts Receivable (AR), Fixed Assets, and Bank Reconciliation.
· Ensure that all accounts are accurate and up-to-date, and that transactions are recorded in accordance with accounting standards.
Accounts Receivable and Accounts Payable:
· Delegate tasks and responsibilities to accounts executives, ensuring that workload is distributed efficiently.
· Provide guidance and support to accounts executives in performing their duties.
· Oversee the work of accounts executives and review their output for accuracy and completeness.
Taxation and Compliance:
· Ensure compliance with tax regulations and prepare and file tax returns.
· Keep up-to-date with changes in tax laws and regulations.
· Prepare reports for Goods and Services Tax (GST) submission and ensure compliance with tax regulations.
· Assist in filing tax returns and maintaining overall tax compliance.
Cash Management:
· Monitor and manage cash flow to ensure the organization has adequate funds for operations.
· Optimize investment of surplus funds to generate returns.
Auditing:
· Collaborate with internal and external auditors during financial audits.
· Implement audit recommendations and ensure internal controls are in place.
Payroll and CPF Submission:
· Handle the payroll process, including salary calculations, deductions, and CPF (Central Provident Fund) submissions.
· Ensure compliance with labor laws and regulations regarding payroll.

Requirements
Minimum 5 years of working experience handling transactions accounting, financial controls, and reporting.
Experience in the full set of accounts required, as well as experience with Singaporean regulations.
Must be able to work independently in a dynamic environment.
Good analytical skills, detail-oriented, meticulous, and able to multitask.
To perform under pressure and meet tight timelines.
Team-oriented, flexible, proactive, and positive working attitude with lots of self-motivation and initiative.
Good command of English and excellent interpersonal skills.
