description:
Roles & Responsibilities
At F5, we strive to bring a better digital world to life. Our teams empower organizations across the globe to create, secure, and run applications that enhance how we experience our evolving digital world. We are passionate about cybersecurity, from protecting consumers from fraud to enabling companies to focus on innovation.
Everything we do centers around people. That means we obsess over how to make the lives of our customers, and their customers, better. And it means we prioritize a diverse F5 community where each individual can thrive.
Role Overview
This strategic sales position requires an in-depth knowledge of how technology is used to enable business goals. It requires strategic thinking coupled with tactical execution of identified business opportunities. You will be responsible for managing all facets of the relationship with key accounts while ensuring revenue goals are being met. Developing opportunities across the F5 solution portfolio while effectively selling solutions and services using technical and customer knowledge to influence and build relationships, while working closely with Systems Integrators, large Service Providers and regional VARs. This is an individual contributor and quota carrying role.
Sounds interesting? Read on!
What You’ll Do
Primary point-of-contact for account/(s) and maintains contact with account at a high, executive level, focusing on the strategic nature of the relationship
Sell the organization’s products or services to and maintains relationships with existing national named accounts. Responsible for rapidly growing and retaining named accounts
Responsible for identifying and qualifying long-term and short-term business opportunities and pro-actively identifying and addressing competitive threats
Prepare formal proposals and presentations, presents to all levels of the organization including executives, leads negotiations, coordinates complex decision-making processes and overcomes objectives to closure, and closes sales in a professional and effective manner
Responsible for significant key partner relationship management and development. Facilitate executive-level relationships between the customer, F5 and its partners including; facilitating communication on strategic and tactical issues and maintaining continuity
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of industry trends, technical developments and government regulations that effect target markets
Understand organization’s business needs, develop application of products and services and communicate how F5’s solutions will address those needs
Determine market strategies and goals for each product and service; understanding the strategies, goals and objectives of named accounts
Assume a leadership role in coordinating territory strategy and tactics for sales support team (inside sales, systems engineering, channel manager)
Assume full responsibility for accurate sales forecasting by demonstrating in-depth knowledge of sales cycles from initial contact through the procurement process and ensure Salesforce is utilized appropriately and maintained on a regular basis
Develop and maintain detailed account profiles including organizational charts for all accounts to be reviewed by management on a quarterly basis
Develop strategy for sustained management and success of business and coordinates resources to ensure goals are met
Partner with internal and external teams and channels to develop creative technical solutions to improve F5´s footprint and Customer dependent in account
What You’ll Bring
8+ years of direct sales work experience in Telco/Enterprise accounts
Telco background Preferred
BA/BS degree preferred
Strong negotiation and closing skills with proven ability in solution selling and presentation abilities
Advanced client interfacing and customer-focused approach
Demonstrated selling skills in a complex matrix environment
Demonstrates effective use of internal relationships and resources
Strong ability to effectively prioritize workload, develop and lead pipeline and forecasting
Requires specialized knowledge in networking products, preferably those of F5
What You’ll Get
Hybrid working mode
Career growth and development opportunities
Recognitions and Rewards
Employee Assistance Program
Competitive pay, comprehensive benefits, and cool perks
Culture of Giving Back
Dynamic Diversity & Inclusion Interest Groups
Apply if you believe your own unique capabilities can contribute to the success of this role and our organization!
The Job Description is intended to be a general representation of the responsibilities and requirements of the job. However, the description may not be all-inclusive, and responsibilities and requirements are subject to change.
Please note that F5 only contacts candidates through F5 email address (ending with @f5.com) or auto email notification from Yello/Workday (ending with f5.com or @myworkday.com).

This policy applies to all aspects of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, discipline, and termination. F5 offers a variety of reasonable accommodations for candidates. Requesting an accommodation is completely voluntary. F5 will assess the need for accommodations in the application process separately from those that may be needed to perform the job. Request by contacting accommodations@f5.com.

Roles & Responsibilities
Our reputation often rests in your hands. You are essential to our survival, our pillar of support without whom we may not stay standing for too long. You are also our eyes and ears on the ground – well-connected, and more often than not, possibly the most influential when dealing with our outreach partners, e.g. like members of the media.
Having said that, we also recognise that you are very new to the industry and as such, are like a sponge, absorbing knowledge, skills and ‘the ways’ from your leaders, peers and clients. We also recognise that this is possibly the most important phase of your career – when you either make it or break it.
Your key responsibilities include:
Public Relations Skills
Being capable of writing media materials (press releases, company backgrounders, spokesperson biographies, media invitations, etc.)
Writing and pitching stories, interactions and engagements to key media personnel
Having a working understanding of new media and its potential
Being capable of handling logistics and organising events (including sourcing of suppliers, venue identification and coordination of personnel) with minimal supervision
Market Knowledge
Conducting regular qualitative and quantitative research, including the design and development of surveys / questionnaires, complimented by knowledge of research resources
Having working knowledge of the clients’ industry, key players, the challenges and opportunities for their business
Being knowledgeable about the communications industry, its key players and our competition
Staying updated on industry and market trends, feeding learnings and key take-aways into overall client and Company strategy, when required
Account Management

Responding to their queries and deliverables
Supporting the team where required to ensure the smooth delivery of tasks
Coordinating and recording of regular work-in-progress meetings both internally and with the client to ensure efficient client delivery
Maintaining a database of media contacts, editorial calendars, conference calendars and other relevant resources on a regular basis for the team and each client
Accountability & Reporting
Organising and delivering on tasks as agreed with your team members
Managing the media (and social media) monitoring process – ongoing compilation of relevant media coverage on the client, its business, the competition and the industry
Diligently completing client reports on time, in accordance to prescribed formats and timelines
Influencer Relations
Having a good understanding of the local media landscape on a whole, with insights on key players, specialist media and the people that matter
Being well-connected with Tier 1 and 2 media relevant to your clients’ business
Taking interest and having an understanding of key influencers (relevant to the practice or clients’ business) in the South East Asian region

You have good presentation skills, are confident in your approach and possess excellent communication and people skills
You have strong research skills and thorough in your approach
You are able to cope well under pressure
You have a positive attitude, are keen to learn

title: Senior Customer Success Manager (Team Leader)
company_info: Digify is a cloud-based document security and data room software that allows customers to control, protect and track important documents after sharing them. Companies use Digify to protect confidential information for fundraising and due diligence, secure intellectual property, and protect sensitive communications. Digify is used in 138 countries today. We have more than 450,000 users worldwide. Learn more about Digify by visiting our website (https://digify.com).
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
WHO WE ARE
Digify is a trusted global provider of cloud-based document security and data room software. Our platform empowers customers to control, protect, and track important documents after sharing them, ensuring confidentiality for fundraising, due diligence, securing intellectual property, and safeguarding sensitive communications.

Digify is trusted by more than 500,000 professionals globally.

THE ROLE
LOCATION: Jurong East

As the Senior Customer Success Manager at Digify, you will be responsible for overseeing all core post-sale functions, including onboarding, support, account management, retention, and expansion. Your focus will be on reducing time-to-value and improving customer satisfaction while driving adoption and customer expansion. You will manage a book of business, and collaborate with other department leaders to optimize customer success processes.

This role requires flexibility working outside the usual working hours, as our global, distributed team serves customers across all continents.

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:
Depending on your experience, you may lead a small team of Customer Success Managers (CSMs). If so, you will be required to lead team meetings and training sessions to foster skill development and knowledge sharing.
Measurably reduce time to value and time to launch through improvements in onboarding processes.
Measure and increase customer satisfaction and Net Promoter Score (NPS) at different points in the customer lifecycle.
Sustainably increase usage and adoption of our product among customers.
Consistently sell customers on expansions to longer-term deals.
Facilitate referral and reference programs to drive customer advocacy.
Improve internal processes and collaboration between Customer Success, Sales, Product, and Engineering teams.
Manage a book of business, including an onboarding pipeline for new accounts.
Handle retention and renewals, acting as a point of escalation for at-risk customers.
Proactively track account health metrics, including NPS and usage, to identify and mitigate retention risks.
Onboard new hires and ensure high employee satisfaction and productivity.
Conduct shadow calls with CSMs to provide real-time guidance and support.
Implement and manage new Customer Success systems and tools to facilitate scale.
Collaborate with the Product and Engineering teams to incorporate customer feedback into the product roadmap and drive prompt resolutions on priority issues.
WHAT YOU NEED TO HAVE:
5+ years of experience, preferably leading a Customer Success function with direct reports.
Experience in a fast-paced, B2B startup environment.
Proficiency in handling Customer Success KPIs.
A proven track record in sales, renewal, or upselling.
Experience overseeing onboarding, account management, retention, and support processes.
Ability to implement Customer Success tools and an operational infrastructure that enables scalability.
Exceptional relationship-building skills and the ability to manage retention of high-value accounts.
Capacity to communicate complex technical concepts in a simple manner to customers.
Strong prioritization skills and the ability to effectively escalate issues when necessary, understanding their impact on the overall business.
Project management abilities to handle multiple customer engagements while leading a team effectively.

title: Strategic Partnership Manager (FI)
company_info: Launched in December 2004 as an escrow service for online purchase on Alibaba's marketplace, Alipay provides secure, trustworthy and convenient online and mobile payment services. As of December 2016, Alipay reached 450 million users. Alipay is expanding to in-store payments both inside and outside China. According to iResearch, Alipay is the largest third-party online payment service provider in China by total payment volume. Alipay currently collaborates with over 200 financial institutions. Alipay is operated by Ant Financial Services Group and provides payment services for Alibaba Group’s marketplaces.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Ant Group traces its roots back to Alipay, which was established in 2004. Today, we are a world-leading internet open platform. Through technological innovation, we support our partners to enable inclusive, convenient digital life and digital financial services for consumers and SMEs (small and micro-sized enterprises). We offer a wide range of digital financial services, including digital payments and digital banking.

Responsibilities:
Build up strategic partnership with major financial institutions in the respective regions/business line, nurturing business collaboration with global banks and other financial institutions
Research on partners’ cash, settlement and FX capabilities, and select the most favorable institutions for business cooperation
Serve as the main contact with banks for business follow-ups, constant review and upgrade of partners’ service level
Research on the business model and compliance policy of oversea funds management practice in local market
Daily work includes but not limited to overseas treasury management, local banks contact, fund management and account management, as well as market analysis on the competitiveness of FX, settlement and other fund-related business offerings across different regions
Conduct research on the latest development of market infrastructure, devise overall global fund platform strategy to improve the overall efficiency and robustness of global fund platform
Manage the various projects for the deliverables and implementation

Requirement:
Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting or business related field
Experience working within corporate/investment banking with extensive knowledge on FX products
In-depth knowledge on global banks’ settlement and FX products, with relevant project experience preferred.
Understand international fund settlement and clearing business, familiar with the operation and business model of cross-border payment, with FX and treasury management project experience in large multinational companies preferred; Knowledge on overseas payment and cross-border funds related compliance policies.
Demonstration of a certain level of leadership or large project management experience preferred
Strong communication skills, certain level of knowledge on financial accounting
The role will require extensive travel overseas

title: Consular Services Manager (Immigration)
company_info: Vialto Partners is focused on transforming the global mobility ecosystem to support multinational organizations and their employees. The organization sparks growth and creates meaningful impact for businesses and individuals in more than 150 countries, supported by a team of over 6,000 dedicated immigration, tax, human resources and technology professionals. ​
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Company description
At Vialto we create the connections that build global careers and societies, bridging the gap between people and their aspirations. As the world of work continues to evolve, we are bringing together the individuals, ideas and technology to unlock business and human growth.

Job Description
As a Manager, you will lead a team of problem solvers with extensive global consulting and immigration experience, helping our clients solve their complex immigration issues from strategy to execution. Innovation forms a critical part of the role and you will be asked to continually reassess how we deliver immigration services to ensure the best experience for our clients and colleagues.

Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Proactively manage a portfolio of clients, while reporting to Senior Managers and above
Manage day to day operations on global client accounts
Manage our inhouse and external network of immigration experts around the world
Provide strategic advice to clients
Be involved in the financial management of clients
Be actively involved in business development activities to help identify and research opportunities on new / existing clients
Contribute to the development of your own and team’s technical acumen
Assist in the management and delivery of large projects
Train, coach and supervise Associates and Senior Associates

Qualifications
The ideal candidate must have previous experience managing the delivery of Consular services to corporate and private clients
Strong client service skills
Able to demonstrate resilience, self-motivation and a positive can do attitude
Hard working and committed to completing tasks well with good attention to detail
Ability to confidentially deal with demanding situations, people and requirements
Proven organisational skills
Clear, articulate and confident written and verbal communication skills that do not require review

Additional information
We are a truly global immigration provider delivering in-house immigration services in 175+ countries. Our immigration services have been independently ranked and we are categorised as Band 1 for immigration by Legal 500. This means that you will get the best training and be part of our market leading team.

title: Temple Manager (with accounting background)
company_info: Sri Krishnan Temple (ஸ்ரீ கிருஷ்ணன் கோயில்,) is a Hindu temple in Singapore. Built in 1870 and gazetted as a national monument of Singapore in 2014, it is one of Singapore's oldest temples and is the only South Indian temple in Singapore dedicated to Lord Krishna and his consort Rukmini. Sri Krishnan Temple is located at Waterloo Street within the Bras Basah.Bugis (BBB) precinct which is Singapore’s arts and heritage district.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Temple Manager plays a vital role in upkeeping the vision and mission of Sri Krishnan Temple, acting in the best interest of the Temple and our staff as well as devotees.

In this role, your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

o Temple management: staff and devotees’ welfare, staff matters, operational and maintenance handling as well as being one of the key contact persons for Temple devotees
o Being present daily to ensure smooth operations of any puja, ubayams etc and responsible for managing and leading the work of temple staff.
o Managing the in-house catering of the temple as well as overseeing prasadam preparation to ensure hygiene standards.
o Handling the full set of accounts and generating quarterly management & financial reports for management review.
o Examining bank statements and reconciling them with general ledger entries.
o Preparing payroll functions to ensure that employees are paid in timely and accurate manner.
o Preparing annual budget and presenting at the Board Meeting.
o Responsible for the fixed assets spectrum including capitalization, disposal, depreciation and revaluations if necessary like gold items.
o Liaising with internal and statutory auditors and preparing necessary schedules required for audit.
o Controlling the incoming and outgoing documentation process and maintaining files and management reports.
o Working with vendors and service providers to keep office systems functioning smoothly at all times.
o Accessing MOM’s WP / EP online, to perform work pass transaction, IRAS’s tax portal to submit employment income of Temple Staff, access CPF EZPay for CPF e-submission
o Accessing the MCCY’s Charity Portal, to update the Temple profile, submit the annual submission of (a) audited financial statements, (b) annual report of the Temple and (c) Governance Evaluation Checklist.
o Liaising with government agencies such as SLA, LTA, IMDA, SDF, SPF for obtaining relevant licences to carry out Temple major / annual events i.e. Sri Krishna Birthday celebration etc.
o Representing Sri Krishnan Temple at various religious events organised by other charitable organisations.
o Attending Board of Trustee’s quarterly meetings and preparing the Minutes.
o Liaising with Education Intuitions i.e. ITEs, Polytechnic & Universities and students with regards to Temple’s major project of SKT Study Award.
o Performing any additional duties as assigned by the Temple Chairman and Board of Trustees.

About this role
o 6-Day Work Week
o Working hours: 8am – 1pm <Break> 5pm – 9pm
o Meals are provided
o Annual leave/medical leave entitlements
o Flexible off days
o Willing to work on weekends and public holidays

To be shortlisted for this role you should have;
o Bachelors degree or equivalent additional education
o Passion to work in a charitable organisation and passion to do service to God
o Knowledge of financial principles, practices, and regulations.
o Proficiency in financial software and systems.
o Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
o Excellent attention to detail and accuracy
o Effectively bilingual in English and Tamil (required for this role)

title: Business Development Manager APAC, Travel Partner Network
company_info: American Express Global Business Travel (“GBT”) provides end-to-end corporate travel and meetings program management – for companies of all sizes and across all industries – through best-in-class booking technology, smart analytics, worldwide strategic partnerships, and exceptional care. Our presence in nearly 140 countries on six continents means that, no matter where our clients do business, we are nearby and ready to help them succeed. Learn more about how GBT connects the world at www.amexglobalbusinesstravel.com.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities

· Manage a portfolio of key travel partnerships in the region and act as primary point of contact for Partners in issue resolution, growth and quality initiatives.
· Drive creation of Client and Supplier Business Development opportunities for Partners. Identify opportunities to strengthen value proposition, outline business model and implement.
· Partner within Amex GBT network, where applicable, to ensure that Partner’s performance is at or above Amex GBT SLA standards.
· Partner within Amex GBT network to support Implementations, Sales and Client Managers to coordinate growth initiatives and new client implementations.

· Ensure accurate and timely invoicing of fees – calculation, invoicing and payments tracking.
· Oversee controls to ensure that Partner members within the Amex GBT network to satisfy network standards.
· Partner with regional colleagues and Regional Director to manage the P&L by implementing an optimal pricing/fee model for partners, ensuring timely invoicing & collection of partnership fees, monitoring performance on Supplier Programs, managing controllable expenses and addressing P&L risk issues.
· Support execution of global initiatives.
· Support fulfilment of ongoing due diligence and compliance requirements (Brand Guidelines, Security Assessments etc).
· Maintain up to date Partner information in the corresponding databases.

Requirements to Succeed:

· Strong consulting and negotiation skills with the ability to influence at all levels within an organization.
· Ability to interface with senior levels of the company, including in-person presentations.
· Proven ability to identify and deliver new business and/or growth opportunities through partnerships.
· Excellent business judgment and a practical, common-sense approach to getting things done.
· An analytical, innovative and creative mindset with strong attention to detail.
· Excellent project and time management skills.
. A team player and enterprise thinker.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our client, a prestigious national bank, is seeking a Corporate and Institutional Relationship Manager for its Singapore office. The successful candidate will be responsible for the daily portfolio management of existing and potential corporate clients to meet financial targets in the assigned geography.

Job descriptions
Develop and manage on a day-to-day basis potential corporate customers and assigned portfolio of existing customers to meet assigned financial and non-financial targets in compliance with established credit policies, procedures, and standards.
Build and maintain strong and effective relationships with all related functions/units to achieve assigned goals/objectives.
Responsible for the day-to-day management of Assistant Relationship Managers (ARM). Ensure appropriate direction of work and duties and that ARM has relevant training and support.
Responsible for business development and origination as well as credit recommendations in favor of selected local and regional corporations
Provide timely and accurate information to the Head of Corporate Banking and head office regarding credit and compliance issues in local and regional markets
Provide timely and accurate information to the external and internal auditors when required.
Processes
Prepare comprehensive credit proposals for new/prospective customers that adequately address all relevant risk factors and satisfy minimum acceptable standards of Credit Portfolio Management.
At least one month before expiry, prepare comprehensive credit reviews for the existing portfolio that adequately address all relevant and current risk factors and the latest developments in the industry, market, and business.
Stress and document periodic calls on customers to capture ongoing businesses
Stress account management to enhance the utilization of lines.
Restrict excess/ casual facilities and maintain the relationship within the approved boundaries.
Control/ reduce the volume of RTAs as much as possible.
Identify and timely report on all negative events and early signals on potential problematic accounts/ relationships.
Obtain all requisite facility and account documentation to ensure each customer's file is current with valid legal documentation to secure/ protect the bank's interests.
Identify opportunities and resolve problems with customer relationships and coordinate appropriate measures with concerned departments to ensure consistent, timely, and accurate delivery of products and services to assigned corporate banking customers.
Coordinate with line departments and counterparts to communicate, discuss, and resolve problems in a teamwork fashion.
Education/Experience Requirements:
University graduate, preferably in Finance.
The ideal candidate should possess relevant relationship management experience built on a sound credit background, typically with 10-12 years of relevant banking experience.
Good knowledge of the banking and commercial environment of the country.
Ability to solve problems and adopt a hands-on role to meet financial targets.
Computer literate and able to compose own correspondences/ reports using bank standard applications.
Good oral and written communication skills both in local and English language.

For consideration, please send your CV to jimmy.soh@ap-executive.com.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our client is a top-tier shipping company with a global presence, specializing in shipping logistics operations. As a market leader in the industry, they are committed to delivering excellence in maritime logistics while upholding the highest standards of professionalism and innovation.
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Accounts Receivables/Credit Management Assistant Manager to join the finance team. This role is pivotal in ensuring the efficient management of accounts receivables and credit functions, maintaining strong relationships with clients, and upholding the financial integrity of the organization.
Key Responsibilities
Accounts Receivables Management:
Oversee and manage the accounts receivables process, including invoicing, billing, and collections.
Monitor and ensure timely and accurate posting of customer payments.
Analyze aging reports and take appropriate actions to reduce outstanding receivables.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to resolve customer disputes and discrepancies.
Credit Management:
Evaluate and assess the creditworthiness of new and existing customers.
Establish and enforce credit policies and guidelines in accordance with company standards.
Set credit limits and terms for customers and review them as necessary.
Monitor and manage credit exposures and mitigate credit risks effectively.
Client Relationship Management:
Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, addressing their inquiries and concerns promptly.
Work closely with the sales and customer service teams to ensure a seamless customer experience.
Negotiate payment terms and agreements with clients when necessary.
Financial Reporting:
Prepare and present regular reports on accounts receivables and credit management to senior management.
Assist in financial forecasting and budgeting related to credit and collections.
Process Improvement:
Identify opportunities to streamline and enhance accounts receivables and credit management processes.
Implement best practices and innovative solutions to optimize efficiency.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field.
4 years of experience in accounts receivables and credit management, shipping or logistics industry preferred but not a must.
Proficiency in financial analysis and the use of accounting software.
Strong communication and negotiation skills.
Attention to detail and a commitment to maintaining financial accuracy.
Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Benefits
Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
Comprehensive health, dental, and flexi benefits.
Opportunities for professional development and advancement within the organization.
A collaborative and inclusive workplace culture.
Interested candidates may contact Charles Lee at +65 9711 9625 or CharlesL@charterhouse.com.sg for a confidential discussion.

Argus produces price assessments and analysis of international energy and other commodity markets and offers bespoke consulting services and industry-leading conferences. description:

We’re looking for a proactive candidate to join our Sales team, where you will rapidly build an understanding of our business and help to grow our customer base and revenue. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Objectives
Develop a well-structured, broad and confident commercial relationship, monitoring and improving the overall relationship with the customer account as required, and ensuring the protection of the Airbus relationship at all management levels within the customer’s organization.

Primary responsibilities
Develop a thorough knowledge of her/his assigned customers:
Develop a confident commercial relationship, monitoring and improving the overall relationship with the customer account as required, and ensuring the protection of the Airbus relationship at all management levels within the customer’s organization
Identify potential Airbus commercial aircraft buyers and operators
Establish regular contacts and develop relationships at all levels of the customers.
Identify the key factors in the customer’s decision making process and develop marketing and commercial concepts, tactics and incentives adapted to each customer to acquire additional business
Define and build a detailed, stakeholder management plan for each customer to which you are assigned
Conducting campaigns to a successful end:
Determine the customer needs in individual sales campaigns. Recommend, coordinate and manage activities of such campaign.
Plan commercial activities in line with priorities, objectives and timescales established by Airbus Commercial Management.
Ensure and monitor internal Airbus alignment and coordination to ensure that the customer receives the best proposal in line with its expectations
Lead and manage the commercial team during the campaigns:
Obtain support from all relevant experts within Airbus and manage the ad hoc campaign team, controlling all Airbus-customer interfaces during the campaign.
Ensure proper and efficient involvement of Airbus Top Management if and when their contribution to a campaign is necessary.
Work in close co-operation with all Airbus departments.
Deliver as a team the best outcome for the customer
Manage key individuals and adapt resources needed to make sure customer’s expectations are met
Maintain the customer relationships after contract’s signature and aircraft delivery:
Watch customers’ economic and financial shape with the view to give to Airbus Commercial Management advance warning in case of problems or defaults, which could put aircraft delivery in jeopardy.
Assist in devising appropriate solutions to problems, if any, and in their settlement with customers.
Participate in, and assist with the organisation and coordination of industry events such as Demonstration tours and Airshows, as well as specific customer conferences and gatherings where hospitality or presentations may be required
Prepare regular reports and briefings as required for Airbus senior management and the organization in general. Such reports should be a concise and accurate representation of the commercial situation at the customer account.
Secondary Responsibilities
Any other duties as per assigned
General
Comply with Airbus Singapore’s management policies
Adhere to Airbus Singapore’s management handbook
Lives and embrace Airbus Code of Conduct
Personal & Interpersonal Skills
Team-player, ready to assume a subordinate role if tactically necessary, but also able to lead a team and to coordinate cross-functionally.
Broad culture, facilitating adaptation as above.
Good listener, able to understand his interlocutors’ perception.
Pro-active and creative.
Professional skills
Team-player, ready to assume a subordinate role if tactically necessary, but also able to

title: Brand Manager / Account Manager
company_info: We are 1103 Studios. We help brands drive business growth using a strategic blend of results-driven marketing, storytelling and creative strategies. job_category: Advertising / Media, Consulting, Marketing / Public Relations
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
🚨𝐀𝐓𝐓𝐍: 𝐌𝐚𝐫𝐤𝐞𝐭𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐖𝐢𝐳𝐚𝐫𝐝! 🪄🌟

If you’ve been searching through countless lifeless job listings…

Almost slipping into a deep coma from the “We’re looking for a highly experienced Marketing Strategist... blah blah blah” job adverts…

And you’re looking for an exciting opportunity to join a fast growing digital agency in the country…

Then this will be the most important job listing you ever read.

Here’s why…
—

We are 1103 STUDIOS.

1103 STUDIOS is a Marketing Agency that thrives at the intersection of strategy, creativity, media, and tech with an expertise in driving business growth for brands.

Our Mission is to build results-driven programs that drive business growth.
And to revolutionise the way businesses are grown.

You see, we are part of a new wave of advertisers who understands the power and potential of digital marketing.

We do it for household brands every Singaporeans heard of - Swensen’s, Jack’s Place, Kopi & Tarts, Uncle Leong Signatures, Spring Court Singapore and a few others.

Coming back...

We're looking to assemble an Avenger's crew of fearless marketers...superstar creatives...content heroes.

And now, we are looking for a Digital Marketing - Senior/Junior to join in the hustle and get rewarded doing something they love.

If this sounds like the opportunity you've been searching for...

Continue reading...

Your Responsibilities Will Include:
Effectively educate and advise clients to provide Campaign Strategies and recommendations to help brand drive business results
Brainstorm ideas, plan and execute objective driven Social Campaigns and creative Content for Brands across social channels, i.e. Facebook, Google, TikTok
Campaigns Strategy and Planning for brands across Social Media such as Facebook, Tik Tok etc
Evaluate performance and provide recommendations to improve Campaign performance
Manage, Grow and Retain existing key Brands
Our Ideal Candidate Will Have:
Must be a seasoned marketer with at least 1 year of proven digital marketing success.
Ability to communicate and present fluently in English and Mandarin
Highly analytical & numbers-driven, leverage data to make informed decisions to drive key objectives.
Direct experience in marketing tools such as Facebook Ads, Google Ads, LinkedIn Ads.
Ability to crafting compelling and effective copy
Ability to design and build Landing page Funnels
A ‘Results-Driven ROA Mindset’
Ability to build good working relationships with clients and co-workers fostering open communication on project planning, progress, and execution.
Demonstrated ability to work independently and effectively manage your time and attention to detail
Has the ability to self-learn and use initiative to solve problems.
A hunger for learning and growth in your career
Familiarity with video/photo production is a plus.
What's In For You:
You will become part of an incredibly crafted and unified company culture with an attentive CEO/Directors and teammates who are truly dedicated to success.
You will work with people from all departments who are happy to help and teach as you work towards growth.
You will be in an environment that is always ready to tackle a new initiative and put creative ideas into action.
Amazing growth prospects and upward mobility in our fast-paced agency.
Onboarding training programme
Develop marketing expertise that is grounded in real-world results that will set you apart in the industry.
The truth is…

No Movement is created by an individual. It takes an entire team united behind one mission.

Collectively working, laughing, brainstorming, and giving their very best as one.

Above all...

The 1103 Studios team is a passionate, dynamic, innovative team. With a mission to help brands drive business growth, we’re looking for great, like-minded people to join us — people who are as hungry, fearless and entrepreneurial.

If you’re looking for a dynamic, no corporate-BS environment to learn, grow, and really make an impact, we could be the perfect fit for you.

Now for a serious question...

Are you a marketer who has been unexpectedly tasked with design responsibilities because your company can't seem to hire a designer?

Don't worry, at 1103 STUDIOS we understand that marketers are not design magicians (although some of us might like to think we are).

Our marketers can focus on what they do best - marketing!

More Importantly...

Are you 1103 STUDIOS’ next Digital Marketing - Senior/Junior?

If yes…

Hit us up (careers@1103studios.com) and tell us a little about your experience and state the following in your application:
· Date of Birth
· Portfolio, CV/Resume
· Earliest Available Start Date

Come hang out with us online!

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/1103studios
Web: https://www.1103studios.com
Glassdoor: http://bit.ly/3HZjNfs

Best of luck,
1103 STUDIOS – To Driving Business Growth

PS: Never give up searching for the job you are passionate about!

title: Business Development and Account Manager
company_info: Laboratories, Food Saftey & Biosecurity Services to Food & Primary Production ASUREQUALITY SINGAPORE PTE. LTD.
address: NATURAL COOL LIFESTYLE HUB, 29 TAI SENG AVENUE 534119
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
A Bureau Veritas AsureQuality Joint Venture Company (BVAQ)
Bureau Veritas is a world leader in laboratory testing, inspection and certification services. Created in 1828, the Group has around 75,000 employees located in more than 1,400 offices and laboratories around the globe
AsureQuality is a leading provider of food assurance and biosecurity services to the food and primary production sectors reaching global markets.

Global leader Bureau Veritas and New Zealand’s premier food assurance business AsureQuality in late 2018 created a new joint venture in South East Asia, BVAQ.

The partnership combines and strengthen the existing footprints across South East Asia. AsureQuality have been operating a strong food testing business with a state-of-the-art laboratory in Singapore since 2010; while Bureau Veritas has newly established food testing laboratories in Vietnam, Thailand, plus a majority share in Permulab – a Malaysian leader in food and water testing. Together, they operate BVAQ as a “network” business model throughout Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Vietnam and Philippines.

BVAQ is looking for candidates to fill up the position.

Areas of Responsibility
Build and deliver the annual and monthly revenue budget with targeted margin, and provide quarterly and monthly forecast
Manage customer relationship and drive sales growth. Develop relationship by customer meeting, engagement and exploring customers’ needs and proposing solutions
Build sales growth strategy, from analyzing market, prioritizing segments, analyzing competition, to proposing value and building strategic plan and actions
Grow and manage sales pipeline, generate leads, identify opportunities, map stakeholder, build proposal and close deals. Report and update sales pipeline and activities in salesforce
Monitor service KPIs, and ensure customer satisfaction in conjunction with Operations and Laboratory managers. Able to coordinate queries and resolve complaints efficiently and effectively
Plan, execute, and close business projects. Responsibility for defining the project, building a comprehensive work plan and ensure delivery
Represent customers’ voice, and support Operations and Laboratory for continuous improvement and development
Promote the company's brand. Attend marketing events such as conferences, exhibitions, promotion of products etc

title: Senior Financial Accountant
company_info: BBC WORLDWIDE CHANNELS (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD.
job_category: Accounting / Auditing / Taxation, Banking and Finance
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Purpose
This role is based in Sydney (Hybrid/open to discussing remote for ANZ only) OR Singapore (Hybrid only). Candidates should have full working rights for ANZ or Singapore.

Reporting to the Financial Controller, APAC, managing the Actuals & Reporting finance function, ensuring that effective reporting and controls are in place and managed to support a diversified and substantial business, delivering the period and year-end close processes for the APAC Region.

Accountabilities
Manages the relationship with the service provider to ensure accurate and timely delivery of monthly accounting tasks to produce a robust financial data to support the close of period and year end; closely managing timelines and quality, raising, discussing and resolving issues with the service provider lead where required.
Supporting the Financial Controller, APAC to produce monthly data for the consolidated APAC Group submissions, and periodic reports of territory performance
Provides analysis, interpretation and variance commentary of APAC results
Monthly Balance Sheet Reconciliations Review APAC
Review payroll reports and process and ensure funding is carried out to meet various payroll deadlines.
Lead and direct the A&R function to perform activities required to fulfil local statutory obligations for tax and audit filings across ANZ and Asia, inclusive of:
o ANZ Annual Income tax and FBT returns, together with tax accounting entries;
o Monthly BAS return and manage withholding tax process across all markets
o Review payroll tax reconciliation and wages declaration for workers compensation purposes
o Review IBM R2R team’s preparation of statutory accounts including supporting work papers
o Work with A&R team and external auditors to deliver on the annual audit process in ANZ, Singapore, South Korea branch;
o Company tax filings for Singapore and Korea branch entity, reviewing GST returns prepared by the service provider, and ensuring lodgement of the same
o Tracking of all statutory obligations for the APAC region
Manage the transition of any additional outsourced tasks to the service provider, inclusive of knowledge transfer, documentation, and stabilisation of activities. Work with the service provide to identify efficiencies and simplification of workflow.
Provide technical training, support and advice to finance team members, and guidance on technical matters to business stakeholders; liaise with internal financial accounting team and external parties for access to resources to ensure teams remain up to date on the latest technical accounting developments
Subject matter expert for financial systems underpinning actuals reporting, sharing knowledge and best practice with local teams and building network across global finance community
Continually review, recommend and manage implementation for improvements in business processes and systems;
Provides adhoc analysis and assistance with regional and global business activities and projects
Adheres to and helps to enforce and improve financial controls and accounting policies

Scope & Impact
This role operates across multiple territories, providing support to a business generating c. £160m of revenue.

The APAC business covers 4 key territories – ANZ, Greater China, Asia & India - all with unique and rapidly changing markets, so will require open-mindedness, agility and adaptability to work in some of the world’s fastest-growing but challenging markets.

The role receives immediate direction from the Financial Controller, APAC and forms part of the APAC A&R function. It offers further opportunity to work on individual projects and gain exposure to the business across the entire region.

The role will also establish and maintain a strong global Finance network and will be in regulate communication with colleagues across the APAC region and finance contacts in the UK.

Strategic Planning & Decision Making
Point of contact for Actuals & Reporting for Consolidated APAC performance, ANZ performance, and communicating territory and line of business performance to colleagues and business stakeholders

Relationships
Reports directly to Financial Controller, APAC
Maintain strong links, via regular face-to-face/phone/email/VC contact, with:
Regional Finance Team including colleagues in Sydney, Singapore, Hong Kong, Beijing and India; contributes positively to a diverse, inclusive and collaborative team ethos
Wider global finance community including Group Finance and Global Distribution Finance, Content Partnerships Finance, Legal, Tax, Treasury and Audit teams as necessary
Business Management and budget owners across APAC

Knowledge, Skills,Education & Experience
The successful candidate should be able to demonstrate the following:
Strong technical accounting skills
High level of competence in Financial / ERP systems – SAP S/4HANA and BPC (preferable)
Provide quick accurate and insightful analysis
Solid written and verbal communication skills, with an ability to guide and direct the service provider
Organisational ability
Commercial acumen
Analytical and financial modelling skills
Proactive, self-starter
A passionate commitment to BBC Studios’ values and vision
Professional Accounting Qualification (Fully Qualified)
Financial and management accounting experience in a multi-national organisation
Previous experience of financial analysis and statutory accounting and reporting
Strong working knowledge of ANZ compliance requirements – tax, and other regulatory bodies
Advanced Excel skills

title: Customer Success Manager
company_info: Cielo is the world’s leading strategic Recruitment Process Outsourcing (RPO) partner. The industry has verified Cielo’s reputation for executing innovative solutions that provide business impact through numerous awards and recognitions, including its annual top three leadership position on the HRO Today RPO Baker’s Dozen listing, Peak Matrix Leader placement by Everest Group and Industry Leader designation by NelsonHall. Cielo leverages its global scale, customized, innovative solutions and entrepreneurial agility to help clients achieve sustained people advantage and outstanding business outcomes. Through world-class, technology-enabled solutions, Cielo serves clients primarily in the financial and business services, consumer brands, technology and media, engineering, life sciences and healthcare industries. Cielo’s global presence includes nearly 1,000 employees, serving more than 90 clients across 57 countries in 26 languages. This footprint includes Moorland Gray, the largest and most successful executive search firm in the Middle East and North Africa. Cielo knows talent is rising – and with it, an organization's opportunity to rise above.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are hiring a Customer Success Manager for a client in the Fintech space.

The Customer Success Manager (CSM) uses industry & product knowledge, business strategy expertise, and account management skills to drive value realization for our customers
Working in collaboration with the wider Chief Customer Office to achieve the vision of providing a world class customer experience in every interaction across the lifecycle as well as focusing on overall client satisfaction, improving retention, renewals and adoption rates in line with our success strategy.
Build and maintain strong internal networks across the Sales, Support, Services and Product organizations, partnering with these teams to deliver the best possible solution(s) & service(s) to our customers
Build strategic relations with our customers by providing proactive customer contact from point of sale and maintaining regular engagement cadence throughout the customer journey
Establish Customer Success plans, building on value proposition(s) developed during sale, that outline the customer’s business goals & priorities.
Maximize value of our solutions for the customer and provide vital internal feedback loop
Oversee onboarding process as customers move from implementation to production
Ensure Sales are aware of x-sell & up-sell opportunities and work in partnership to deliver.
Actively manage account to identify risks proactively. Orchestrate resolution process for escalations, working with & mediating internal teams to track, manage and resolve these in a timely and professional manner.
Communicate process/ tools/ systems improvement opportunities to the Customer Success Operations team
Embody and celebrate customer centricity –contribute to internal knowledge sharing and enablement sessions within Customer Success team and the wider business

Skills & experience:

Must be a graduate of a Bachelor's Deg
Experience in a customer facing role (consulting, customer support, account management) that includes issue resolution & relationship management
Passionate about delivering success for customers, embodies a customer centric mindset and strives to deliver excellence at every opportunity
Strong communication, presentation and interpersonal skills. Demonstrates ability to challenge, negotiate, influence and persuade stakeholders
Ability to work Autonomously, take ownership & accountability
Technical and problem-solving skills. Demonstrates a design thinking mindset – ability to understand/recognize route causes of challenges
Organisational skills – can prioritize, multi-task and demonstrates adaptability.
Project Management skills including strong reporting capability
Commercial & Business Acumen – understand & speak to business drivers
Experience developing and delivering against Customer Success plans
Experience in Customer Success role in similar Industry and/or regional
Experience of CRM tooling

Marketing - Actively contribute to marketing strategies and activities to support lead generation.
Communication – The Sales Manager will be responsible for arranging Sales Progress meetings and ensuring that all stakeholders are aware of progress.
Degree or Diploma in any Engineering Discipline
Possess knowledge in Facade Access, Material Handling and Safety Equipments would be an advantage.

Job Summary:

title: Business Development Manager – International
company_info: Our forerunner, National Air Traffic Control Services (NATCS), was established in December 1962. It covered civil ATC but liaised with the Ministry of Defence (RAF) in areas where military traffic needed to cross civilian routes. When the Civil Aviation Authority (CAA) was established in April 1972, NATCS became part of it and shortened its name to NATS. We recognised that as a service provider, NATS should be operated at a distance from its regulator the CAA. With that in mind, NATS was re-organised into a Companies Act company in April 1996 and became a wholly owned subsidiary of the CAA. In June 1998, the Public-Private Partnership for NATS was proposed and enshrined in the Transport Act 2000. The Government chose the Airline Group (AG) as the preferred partner in March 2001 and the transaction was completed in July 2001 with the sale of 46% to the AG and the remaining 5% to staff. Although the Government retained the balance, the company was free of Treasury Control. The aviation industry downturn after 11 September 2001 led to a financial restructuring of NATS. This involved £130 million of additional investment (split between Government and Heathrow Airport Holdings Limited) to reduce borrowings. At the same time, Heathrow Airport Holdings Limited took a 4% shareholding, reducing the Airline Group’s holding to 42%. A £600 million bond issue, successfully completed in October 2003, further reduced our debt. In 2003, NATS launched its ten-year £1 billion investment programme with the announcement of a complete renewal of its radar network. Since then, we have worked with Nav Canada on a new system for Oceanic Control and became the first in Europe to establish a working Functional Airspace Block (FAB) with Irish counterparts. We also launched a Joint Venture company with the Spanish to develop the next generation of air traffic management systems for Europe.
job_category: General Management, Marketing / Public Relations, Professional Services, Telecommunications
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Role Profile
Role Title: Business Development Manager – International
Function: NATS Services Ltd (NSL)
Business: NATS International
Location: Singapore
Reports To: Head of Accounts and Partnerships – International

Role Purpose
To grow the NATS business (Order Intake, revenues, and EBIT) in designated accounts and countries. The role is responsible for NATS interests in this market, developing and implementing strategies, and to successfully build a sustainable business by establishing enduring/trusted relationships at all stakeholder levels.

Key Accountabilities
· Provide account management leadership in respect of international business accounts for NATS in priority countries, as directed and agreed with Head of Accounts and Partnerships – International.
· Develop and grow business across the designated countries and accounts to achieve associated targets.
· Develop and execute Country Plans and Account Development Plans for priority countries and accounts, including stakeholder maps and stakeholder engagement plans, and support NATS International strategy development.
· Generate opportunity weighted pipeline cover which is more than 150% of subsequent FY target for the allocated countries and accounts.
· Build and maintain key business relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
· Ensure NATS maintain a credible presence in each country or region to ensure that NATS Group capabilities are fully exploited.
· Own commercial propositions made to the customers within designated portfolio
· Oversee successful delivery of contracts and own all variation orders made to existing contracts within designated portfolio.
· In conjunction with the business development and business winning teams, identify and prioritise new business opportunities across priority countries.
· Lead the relevant Account Teams brought together from across the NATS functions to collaborate effectively and ensure successful preparation and submission of bids through to contract award.
· Ownership of accurate and timely business area performance reporting.

Qualifications, Skills and Personal Attributes
· Excellent knowledge of the aviation industry and ATM market.
· Proven business development and/or contract delivery experience in a large or complex, multi-function/multi-stakeholder, environment.
· Excellent leadership skills.
· Proven financial management experience.
· Able to lead the development of compelling business cases.
· Excellent influencing and negotiation skills.
· Comfortable in matrix management environments and with non-hierarchical structures.
· Able to assimilate and prioritise large volumes of complex financial and technical data, identify key issues and solutions.

· Required to work flexibly across different time zones and working weeks.

title: Senior Payroll Manager
company_info: About Humanica Humanica is a publicly listed software company headquartered out of Bangkok, Thailand and trusted business solutions provider since 2003. We have over 1000 employees working across Asia in our regional offices in Singapore, Jakarta, Kuala Lumpur, Penang and Ho Chi Minh. Humanica celebrates its 20th year of excellence in providing HR software and Payroll outsourcing solutions and is the leading HR solutions provider in Southeast Asia, serving thousands of customers and over two million employees. Humanica is also developing our award winning solution for other countries in Asia in collaboration with our network of partners. We believe in combining our technology with our deep industry knowledge and experience to provide the change agent to accelerate business growth for our clients. We offer an attractive and unique opportunity to be part of an exceptional team, sharing our fast-growing success stories in the HCM industry. For the very beginning, we have valued excellence, integrity, teamwork and openness above all else.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
Manage Humanica Group’s payroll outsourcing services and HRIS operations program.
Define, propose and implement the company’s outsourcing policy, which must be approved by the COO.
Monitor the outsourced services or functions and manage the risks associated with outsourcing.
Provide excellent client support and account management services to existing clients to further enhance client satisfaction and engagement.
Complete prior and in-depth analysis (risk assessment) for any contemplated outsourcing including a description of services, expected results and a detailed evaluation of the risks for, among other things, financial, operational, legal and reputational risks.
Monitor, report and propose changes to outsourcing policy and procedures due to changes in the company’s obligations with main focus on outsourcing guidelines in compliance with government / statutory regulations.
You will ensure compliance to SOPs, regulatory updates and liaise with local statutory authority regards to local pension, insurance, tax and etc.
Monitor, report and propose changes to increase on SLA performance of each outsource clients (where applicable).
Work with the internal control functions on monitoring, identifying and remediating issues.
Work with Humanica Group’s Legal & Compliance team to fulfil our obligations regarding protection of clients data.
Reviewing internal operational policies and procedures to ensure they are continuously updated in line with industry standards and/or clients expectations.
Supporting talent acquisition initiatives for new and replacement roles by participating in the drafting of JDs, shortlisting and interviewing of candidates.
Train new employees on company policies and procedures and understand Humatrix and Workplaze systems which are the main systems of the company.
Working closely with the HR team to manage the learning needs of the international team.
Assigning work tasks to employees based on their job description, experience level and skill set.
Managing with payroll team to ensure payroll records are accurate.
Managing employee performance through regular meetings and performance evaluations.
Job Requirements
Degree in Human Resources, Management, Finance or equivalent
Minimum 7 to 10 years of relevant payroll processing and statutory compliance experience for Singapore at a managerial level.
Hands-on working experience in an outsourcing environment and managing large scale HR system implementation projects.
Working knowledge of HCM or Payroll software with solid hand-on experience in full spectrum of payroll processing. Preferably Humatrix or Workplaze system.
Excellent communication skills, written and verbal and ability to liaise effectively with various stakeholders.
Detail-oriented, organized, and able to manage projects within set timelines.
Applicant who has experienced in payroll outsource it would be an advantage
Team attitude and ability to work with a variety of skillsets and autonomously.
Process an analytical and inquisitive mindset.

Why joins us:

Humanica is a publicly listed software company headquartered out of Bangkok, Thailand and trusted business solutions provider since 2003. We have over 1000 employees working across Asia in our regional offices in Singapore, Jakarta, Kuala Lumpur, Penang and Ho Chi Minh. Humanica celebrates its 20th year of excellence in providing HR software and Payroll outsourcing solutions and is the leading HR solutions provider in Southeast Asia, serving thousands of customers and over two million employees.

Humanica is also developing our award winning solution for other countries in Asia in collaboration with our network of partners. We believe in combining our technology with our deep industry knowledge and experience to provide the change agent to accelerate business growth for our clients.

We offer an attractive and unique opportunity to be part of an exceptional team, sharing our fast-growing success stories in the HCM industry. For the very beginning, we have valued excellence, integrity, teamwork and openness above all else.

At Humanica, it is all about being agile and responsiveness to our clients while continuing to innovate through our technology. We firmly believe that our success comes from the strength of our people, our number one winning strategy. We encourage equal opportunity and diversity in our multinational workplace. We will be happy to speak with you if you have what it takes or inspire to be one, please reach out to us.

title: Corporate and Workplace Solutions, Spend Management and Accounting Services, Associate (116276)
company_info: The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world. GOLDMAN SACHS SERVICES (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
WHO WE ARE
The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and high-net-worth individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in Hong Kong, Singapore, London, Frankfurt, Tokyo and other major financial centres around the world.

OUR IMPACT
The objective of the Procure to Pay (P2P) group is to deliver commercial value and front-to-back cost transparency across the firm. Procure to Pay is under the Spend Management umbrella and is divided into 4 pillars, Vendor Data Control, Expense Management, Procurement Operations, Accounting & Tax Controls. Procure to Pay manages $10B annual spend for the firm from requisition to payment/posting.

HOW YOU WILL FULFILL YOUR POTENTIAL
Manage payments to vendors & service providers for Asia entities including vender profile set up and invoice processing in SAP payment platforms
Acquire in depth understanding of the regulations, tax handling and accounting controls in multiple jurisdictions in Asia associated with vendor/ employees’ travel & expense payments
Understand and adhere the firm’s policies on vendor governance, payment management and documentations
Handle business and management ad-hoc queries and requests, respond to business queries on a timely basis
Participate in firm wide platform changes relating to Expense Management
Manage risks in the process by implementing and reviewing relevant controls
Conduct data analysis to identify the trend/root cases in order to effectively engage the stakeholders to address problems and opportunities for improvements
Develop and deliver training programs to the team and end-users
Exhibit confidence in communicating in a variety of forums, sessions, presentations, training sessions and town halls
Work with internal departments/divisions including Engineering and Divisional Finance and from a third party operating expense angle
Build relationships with businesses at all levels within the corporation will be a key success factor for this position
SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE WE ARE LOOKING FOR
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree with 1-3 years’ experience in relevant profiles
Knowledge and experience in accounts payable, invoice processing, employee’s travel and expense, and vendor management
ERP Knowledge, Implementation/Transformation experience on SAP (Concur, Ariba, Fieldglass, S4/HANA)
Excellent knowledge of spreadsheets and MS Office products
Strong communication/presentation skills
Interpersonal skills to develop/sustain good working relationships with other teams and stakeholders
Excellent partnership building skills and strong customer service perspective
Good problem solving skills
Effective organizational and time management skills
Forward thinking with the ability to assert new ideas and follow them through
Japanese speaker required as this role will cover clients in the Japan market
Preferred Qualifications
Hands on experience in end to end GL activities, month-end activities (accruals, sub-ledger / general ledger posting and reconciliations) is an added advantage
Corporate Card Feed management/operation and handling payments is an added advantage
DIVISION DESCRIPTION:
Who We Are
The Corporate and Workplace Solutions Division (CWS) focuses on commercial management, client support, advisory solutions, strategic planning, risk management, people security, real estate strategy and the enablement of collaboration and productivity tools across the firm.
We deliver a world-class work experience and environment, managing the firm’s corporate real estate strategy, client engagement solutions, essential commercial and risk management functions and flexible digital workstyles that drive the firm’s operating efficiency and productivity.

How We’re Organized
Workplace Experience - Encompasses the comprehensive onsite workplace experience, how people interact with the workplace, on and off-site events and our overall location strategy. Departments include Events, Real Estate Strategy, Real Estate Development and On-Site Solutions, which is comprised of Document Management, Facilities, Ground Transportation and Hospitality.
Spend Management - Encompasses the functions responsible for managing all aspects of the firm's spend with third parties -- advising commercial agreements, managing third party and payment risk and driving operating efficiency. Departments include Product Finance, Strategic Sourcing, Third Party Governance, Procure to Pay, Integrated Travel and Expense and Infrastructure and Transformation.
CWS Engineering - Aligns several engineering functions focused on collaboration and productivity tools. Departments include Digital Workplace, Client and Production Engineering, Corporate Engineering , Spend, Data and Automation, Windows Engineering and Product Success and Delivery Engineering.
Office of Global Security (OGS) - Protects the people and assets of Goldman Sachs to ensure a safe and secure environment. Assesses risk to enable the delivery of effective security, fire and life safety protocols and leads crisis management preparation, implementation and recovery processes. Includes Physical Security & Investigations, Executive Protection, Fire Safety and Crisis Management.
Divisional Management (COO) - Aligns division-wide functions to drive strategic cohesiveness, consistency and efficiency. Departments include Business Unit Management, Communications and User Engagement, Risk and Environmental, Social & Governance.

ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS
At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.
We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.

We’re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html

job_category: Accounting / Auditing / Taxation, Building and Construction
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Assistant Accountant/Accountant
5 Days 8.30am to 6pm
Salary: $3500 to $4500
Address: Kranji

Job Requirements:
• At least 3 years of relevant experience of related field
• Experience to handle audits

Job Description:
Lead a team of account executives and account assistants to maintain the books of company accounts and its Group companies. Responsible for all aspects of on-going as well as year-end activities ensuring consistently fair and transparent financial statements.
Maintain books of accounts for all companies under the Group
Posting of all accounting entries related to income, expense as well as journals as required.
Oversee and maintain cashflow. Review the system for invoicing, tracking payments as well as aging analysis of outstanding AP/AR.
Ensure good practice in recording and filing of expenses.
Ongoing reconciliation of bank and cash accounts, ensuring that the books are balanced.
Ensure inter-company accounts are balanced and reconcied.
Oversee year-end procedures - accruals, prepaids, receivables and payables; any other journals as required.
Financial year-end preparation of accounts for audit. Liaise with Auditors to ensure clean signoff. Follow up on closing any audit gaps.
Initiate tax planning, GST reporting and oversee periodical tax filings
Work closely with the respective business units to ensure accurate and timely reporting.
Ensure the integrity and accuracy of the Group consolidation
Prepare monthly, yearly, adhoc and consolidated reports.
Suggest process improvement of in-house system or automatizing processes and procedures.

Email: supreme.cc.han@gmail.com

We are helping Thatz International Pte Ltd to identify suitable talents to help them to grow their business in the new norm. Selected talents will be placed with them to carry out their Next-Generation ICT Engagement and Consultancy (Thatz 2.0) or Outsourcing business.

Sales Account Manager (ICT & Outsourcing)
Job Title: Sales Account Manager (ICT & Outsourcing)
Work Location: Central Area, Singapore
Job Type: Permanent

Job Summary
The Account Manager acts as a key point of contact between an organisation and its clients. He/She possesses thorough product knowledge and oversees product and/or service sales. He/she works with customers to identify their needs and prepares reports by collecting, analysing, and summarising sales information. He/she contacts existing customers to discuss and give recommendations on how specific products or services can meet their needs. He/she maintains customer relationships to strategically place new products and drive sales for long-term growth.
He/she works in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, and travels frequently to clients' premises for meetings. He/she is familiar with client relationship management and sales tools. He/she is knowledgeable of the organisation's products and services, as well as trends, developments and challenges of the industry domain.
The Account Manager is a resourceful, people-focused and persistent individual, who takes rejection as a personal challenge to succeed when given opportunity. He/she appreciates the value of long lasting relationships and prioritises efforts to build trust with existing and potential customers. He/she exhibits good listening skills and is able to establish rapport with customers and team members alike easily.

Primary Responsibilities:
A) Business Development and Sales Generation
· To promote and market Thatz 2.0 core competencies in Business Solutions and Nextgen Enterprise ICT Services.
· Responsible for business development, revenue growth, productivity, and profit of each customer engagement.
· Implement sales strategy, identify new sales opportunities, and convert sales opportunities to meet sales targets.
· Prepare proposals, costings, quotations, and presentation deck, as well as lead the meetings with customers to turn the business opportunity into sales.
· Advise the customer on technology adoption and implementation strategy including architecture, integration, selection, and operation to improve the success of the customer’s business operation.
· Manage and coordinate resources, as well as, meet contract obligations to deliver good customer satisfaction.
· Collaborate with the Technical Support Team to develop effective sales action programs.
· Work closely with Channel Partners and Principals to develop and promote new products and services to existing, as well as, new clientele.
B. Customer Relationship Management
· Establish and sustain strong business relationships between Thatz and the customers through informal meetings and networking activities.
· Seek business opportunities from customers and fulfill their business needs promptly to convert them into sales.
C. Others
· Strategize, plan, execute, and monitor/review/modify the business development and sales function implementations to achieve the agreed objectives and targets ahead of schedule or on a timely basis.
· Support regional business expansion plan, when necessary.

What we are looking for?
1. Diploma in Sales and Marketing, or related field.
2. At least 2 years of working experience, preferably in the Sales and Marketing field in the ICT industry with good customer engagement expertise.
3. Professional, enterprising, resourceful, self-initiated/starter/motivated, detailed, and sales/result-oriented personnel.
4. Quick learner and adaptive to a dynamic working environment.
5. Reliable and able to take ownership of areas under your responsibilities.
6. A team player and able to work under pressure.
7. Excellent English writing and communication skills.
8. Looking for long-term career advancement within the company.

What will the Career Progression / Path be like?
1. Business / Management Executive (up to 3 years*)
2. Assistant / Manager / Senior (3 to 8 years*)
3. Director/ Senior (8 to 12 years*)
4. Junior/Partner/Senior (> 10 years*)
Note: * based on your actual performance.
Salary Package: Monthly Basic Salary (50%) + Profit sharing (50%).

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
OVERVIEW
In a world subject to massive disruption, where technology is changing the way brands used to target and communicate with their audience and agency groups are forced to reinvent themselves, it is refreshing to find a technology organisation which has developed a state of the art platform that connects the dots between data collection, market research, media and content by leveraging the power of Artificial Intelligence (AI).
SQREEM Technologies is an award-winning technology organisation that offers consumer insights to its clients, produces content at scale by identifying which topics are relevant to the various consumer segments, offers smart digital media solutions and CRM capabilities that can be leveraged by advertisers or integrated with their in- house CRM tools.
SQREEM Technologies has a core A.I. platform that anonymously learns from over three billion people across 60 countries, daily. It tracks millions of behaviours in massive amounts of data, has been successfully deployed across 40 countries, in the native languages of the generates over multiple of millions of dollars in sales

For more details, visit https://sqreemtech.com

Digital Account Manager Job Responsibilities
• Be the point of contact for Client requests and client servicing team
ensuring that briefs are met with quality and timeliness.
Work with Operation teams on required day to day deliverables and manage client expectations by identifying and delivering the best possible digital solutions. Ensure quality of all works before delivery to clients.
Maintain timeline and ensure delivery for key milestones including presentations and approvals.
Work collaboratively with the internal/external/remote teams to monitor media campaigns.
Build and maintain strong, long-lasting relationships with agency and internal teams.
Support in pitches and new accounts where required.
Develop and maintain a trusted consulting relationship with client such that all activities are closely aligned with the customer's business strategy.
Establish and oversee adoption, training and usage/development of standard methodologies to continually drive incremental value and return on the campaign's investment.
Produce comprehensive reports for the clients with in-depth insights to improve future campaigns.
Drives regular governance with client to report on critical metrics. Shares results & meaningful items with cross-functional partners.
Collaborate with and demonstrate other teams/resources internally to bring in product specialists to meet the needs of customers.
Perform appropriate duties as assigned by management.
Requirement
4 ~6 years of experience in the digital media industry.
Work experience in client side, agency, or digital platform selling digitalmedia solutions.
