description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Creative Bulb Pte Ltd is expanding our sales team to make our events even bigger and better. We're looking for a Business Development Manager to join our team and work on some of the most exciting events and exhibitions for the company.

As a Assistant Sales Manager, you will be responsible for marketing our services and prospecting exhibition packages. You are require to conduct research, market survey and prospecting for new clients, as well as rebooking existing clients. You will be setting up online meetings, phone calls and face-to-face meetings to better understand the challenges the prospects are facing and how our services can help make a difference to them. You will be account managing your clients, building a lasting relationship with them and making sure that you’re helping them achieve their objectives.

Responsibilties:
Sales and business development
Meeting with potential and existing clients to increase opportunities and revenue
Identifying events/projects and sales that would appeal to new clients, both locally and overseas
Working with partners/sponsors to identify new opportunities to deliver innovative event/project management services
Participate in marketing activities to increase brand awareness and gain new clients
Managing company and clients' expectations
Developing strategic plans and solutions to drive sales
Developing solutions to improve clients experience and retain brand loyalty
Developing proposals, quotations and tenders for enquiries and negotiating terms to secure sales opportunities
Analysing potential strategic partner relationships for corporate marketing plan and execute joint promotions
Develop and implement full spectrum of marketing and communication strategies and public relations responsibilities for the company
Work closely with team members to ensure smooth operations at all events locally and overseas
Work closely with graphic designer to produce and implement designs to suit clients' expectations
Requirements:
Diploma / Degree in Business or relevant sales/ marketing or other related fields preferred
Minimum 2 years of relevant working experience in business development
Those with less experience but with right qualities will be considered
Meticulous and strong organizational skills especially in projects/ events management
A good team player and the ability to work efficiently under pressure and keep to projects deadlines
Strong sales and negotiation techniques.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Applications, in particularly Excel and Powerpoint
Possesses leadership skills
Ability to work independently and manage time efficiently
We offer a base salary, commission structure, group health benefits and work from home allowance. If you are a results-driven sales professional with a passion for the conference industry, we would love to hear from you.

title: Head of Regional Service Management
company_info: We are a travel technology company who builds critical solutions that help airlines and airports, hotels and railways, search engines, travel agencies, tour operators and other travel players to run their operations and improve the travel experience, billions of times a year, all over the world.
address: MAPLETREE BUSINESS CITY, 10 PASIR PANJANG ROAD 117438
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Head of Regional Service Management is responsible to translate the strategy into a concrete action plan planing, designing and developing requested services and coordinate their implementation, and activate it through the people management.

Job Description
Common accountabilities:
- Manages large teams or other Managers; has accountability for the performance and results of multiple related units.

- Develops departmental plans, coordinates allocation of resources and controls policy formation in area of responsibility. Anticipates business issues and challenges for the department to define and resolve complex problems that may impact into the division / function.

- Works following the overall department strategy, with limited supervision in a complex environment

Specific accountabilities:
* Provide a work load assessment from high level service proposals.
* Identify detailed lists of specific tasks necessary to develop and deliver requested services.
* Evaluate service feasibility, cost and potential benefits.
* Define and document service development framework including precise sizing, tasks, priority, resources and delivery dates for all requested and approved services.
* Assign the service design activities to the appropriate groups.
* Coordinate service design phases.
* Monitor and report on service development status.
* Ensure that the support environment is properly configured and data updated prior to roll-out of new or adapted services.
* Notify support organizations of all service additions and changes prior to roll-out.

About the ideal candidate
• Master’s Degree in Science or Management.
• Minimum 10 years’ experience with at least significant references in a similar position for an international software vendor, a major IT Services provider, or a leading Consulting firm.
• An experience in the Airline industry is a plus.
• Has a track record of solving customer’ pain points and recognized for delivering value.
• Has experience as a business developer with a strong project management background.

title: Senior Sales Manager
company_info: INTERCONTINENTAL SINGAPORE
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
WHAT’S THE JOB?
Develop new sales opportunities, build a robust sales platform and manage assigned account base in order to generate revenue and maximise performance both for the short and long term in line with sales target. Conducts active market research and intelligence for the hotel to provide feedback on competitors, market trends and identifying new business potentials. To maintain flexibility to perform other duties and projects as required and as directed by leadership team as deemed necessary to support Hotel’s overall business objectives

YOUR DAY TO DAY
Research market place and pursue opportunities for potential new accounts
Manage assigned account base to exceed targets for total revenue
Develop and maintain contact with key decision makers, influencers, meeting planners, event organisers, associations and other producers closely aligned to each business unit
Monitor and report on sales activity undertaken and measurement of results through maintaining of accurate records in the sales tools and action plans
Act as a trusted business advisor by clients; ensure that commitments are met and value is delivered
Planning and preparation for overseas sales visit, trade fairs, educational or familiarization groups; if any, to promote the hotel and develop potential business
Minimum of 20 sales-related activities (such as sales calls, site inspections and in-house entertainments) per week
Work closely with Revenue Management to ensure that pricing and yield management principles are being communicated and implemented.
Monitor competitor practices and accounts, monthly RGI scorecards and diagnostic tools in order to understand competitor trends
Ensure that all stakeholders are made aware of systems, procedures, and information relating to the delivery of all revenue from sales market segments
Maintain strong presence in the local community by participating in business / industry organisations, associations and developing a broad external network
Ensure active management of individual GAPs and personal development plan.
Other duties as assigned by Director of Sales or the management
WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU
Diploma/Degree in Business or Hospitality management or related disciplines
Minimum 2 years’ experience in a sales capacity or equivalent work experience including development of account portfolio and business development.
Strong presentation, commercial and communication skills
Strong influencer and persuader
A self-driven personality
Resourceful and goal oriented
Strategic and tactical thinker - ability to develop strategic sales plans, establish goals and objectives, set performance targets and deliver projects on time
In-depth knowledge of sales principles and techniques
Proactive approach to developing and maintaining strong relations with clients and stakeholders including customers’ senior management
Comprehension of Hotel systems and revenue management principles
Keeps abreast of changes and assesses trends in market conditions and consumer buying behaviour to create strategies that drive business opportunities
Flexible work approach

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our client is a well-established MNC, market leader in the logistics Industry. They are looking for a Sales Manager / Director to assist their team for the next phase of their business. They are located in the East - easily accessible.

Responsibilities:
Spearheading and directing sales efforts across Asian Branches, driving growth for a range of products.
Playing a hunter role with an enticing commission structure, motivating results-driven performance.
Initiating and nurturing leads, arranging appointments, and presenting compelling business proposals to potential customers through various communication avenues such as face-to-face meetings, phone calls, and emails.
Diligently managing and sustaining sales pipelines, promptly responding to information requests, and maintaining proactive engagement with prospective clients.
Developing and executing a strategic plan for weekly sales calls.
Vigilantly pursuing all sales leads to maximize conversion opportunities.
Delivering timely weekly and monthly reports to management, providing insights into sales activities and outcomes.
Conducting comprehensive market analysis, including competitor, carrier, and manufacturer/customer assessments, to remain well-informed about market dynamics and trends.
Operating with a self-driven approach and taking ownership of the Profit and Loss (P&L) for the designated region.
Responsively addressing Tenders/RFQs to optimize opportunities.
Establishing effective collaboration with various departments, including Account Management, Operations & Logistics, and Finance, to ensure seamless execution of sales strategies and client satisfaction.
Requirements:
Proven leadership experience in sales, ideally within the Logistics Industry
Strong pipeline management and responsiveness to prospective clients.
Market-savvy with a keen understanding of competitors, carriers, and customer trends.
Swift responsiveness to Tenders/RFQs.

title: Regional Program Manager
company: BCD TRAVEL ASIA PACIFIC PTE. LTD.
company_info: BCD TRAVEL ASIA PACIFIC PTE. LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
BCD Travel: Connect, collaborate and celebrate
Regional Program Manager (Hybrid/Remote)
Full-time, Singapore
As a Regional Program Manager, you are responsible for managing all aspects of assigned client portfolio of global account(s) to include but not limited to client retention, contract negotiation, implementation and business consolidation, sales of products and services, financials, business planning and reviews, establishing relationships with key decision makers in multiple regions, staff development and business continuance. You have direct accountability to BCD Travel or externally to the customer for the success of the contract or travel program across multiple countries across Asia Pacific.
As a Regional Program Manager, you will
Ensure 100% client retention and account profitability
Increase revenues by means of Up-Selling and Cross-Selling through consultative approach, ensuring solution meet customer's needs
Negotiate client contract terms and manage to all contractual terms
Act as conduit and trusted advisor, share best practice and industry updates
Coordinate all central communication across countries both BCD Travel and client's regional initiatives or interests
Ensure timely settlement of customer P&Ls where required and necessary as per contractual obligation
Develop and execute business plans, implement key deliverables and measure results
Develop, measure and report on Service Level Agreements and Key Performance indicators
Create and manage business improvement plans
Manage new business implementations
Establish and maintain relationships with clients at a multi-national level, stakeholders within BCD Travel and Advito, (global) suppliers and industry relations
Create and manage to budgets and financials (includes billing, payment & profitability)
Support operational and regional reporting requirements
About you
Minimum 3 years of account management experience in corporate travel or related industry
Bachelor degree
Fluent in Business English
Experience in implementing and managing large market/global clients
Thorough knowledge of travel industry technology and corporate travel operations
Strong cultural awareness of Asia Pacific markets
Knowledge of contract management
Strong negotiation and analytical skills
Ability to cross-sell company services and products and sell preferred vendors
Ability to interact with all levels of clientele and influence decision makers
Excellent oral and written communication skills, including public speaking and presentations
Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
About us
We’re a market leader in travel management: We help people and companies travel smart and achieve more, and our clients include some of the world’s best-known and most innovative business and consumer brands. We operate in more than 100 countries, and the majority of our 10,000+ people work virtually (because a 10-second commute usually makes awesome sense). We’re committed to sustainability and to driving success for our customers, our business and ourselves. Learn more about BCD Travel.
Your life at BCD
Working at BCD means connecting, collaborating and celebrating. description:

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Start your career by making an impact and real connections with some of the most meaningful challenges around. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our performance culture comprised of diverse leaders, thinkers, innovators, dreamers, and doers who are changing the future.

Make the Best You.
Working at Honeywell is not just creating incredible things. You will have the opportunity to work with our talented and friendly team of professionals and be part of a global team of future shapers.

Join Us and Make an Impact.
We are on the lookout for a proactive and visionary Sales Manager with a focus on sustainability technology solutions. This role is a primary customer interface responsible for the development of new business and new relationships in pursuit of growth for Honeywell across our full portfolio of Sustainable Technology Solutions – including Renewable Fuels, Advanced Plastics Recycling, Carbon Capture and Blue Hydrogen technologies, leveraging our broad suite of offerings. The role disseminates key messages, initiatives, and information on the value Honeywell brings to both self-identified and assigned customers, opportunities, and solutions.

Use your knowledge of customers, the industry and competition to identify and pursue opportunities for growth for Honeywell's Sustainable Technologies business. You will develop the strategy to gain new customers and to identify opportunities at our existing customer base to introduce new ways to deploy our technologies to build a robust sales pipeline across the region. You will partner closely with various functions of Honeywell and industry to create a roadmap, which will include building strategic customer relationships, joint ventures, partnerships, and developing other critical alliances.
As a key member of the Sales/BD team you will use your commercial experience and technical knowledge to develop the market and work closely with the sales organization to deliver successful outcomes to grow the STS business. You will develop appropriate market stakeholder relationships including country regulatory agencies, upstream / midstream and downstream operators, sequestration hub developers, EPCs and local partners as required to successfully position Honeywell solutions. Moreover, you will act as a business partner with potential customers, establishing relationships & maximizing the business potential for both parties.

Key Responsibilities:
Develop customer relationships with companies looking to deploy STS solutions
Calling at all levels, including senior levels, of target customer organizations; engaging early with customer that are seeking technologies related to decarbonization
Lead Sustainable Technologies Business Development activities for OAP Region
Partner with sales to negotiate and close transactions
Acts as an advisor/consultant to understand customers unmet needs
Be able to hold technical and economic discussions with end users
Continuously identifying new sales opportunities and focusing on providing consultative support by building value propositions for solutions into the account
Managing and building customer contacts, serving as Honeywell’s ambassador in the APAC marketplace.
Regional focal point for relationship strategies, account and sales plans, proposal strategies, and contract negotiations. Liaise with Global STS Business Development Managers and Business Team on all pursuits and negotiations
Accountable for/lead team through opportunity assessment and development process through NDA, project assessment, credit/risk review, commercial and financial diligence & compliance review
Responsible for motivating others; providing strategic vision for growth in this new space while driving self and others for positive business results for Honeywell and the customer
Support internal teams (Proposal/Technical Solution Consultants/Line of Business) by offering market & competitive insights and help develop compelling value proposition
Relentless drive to excel in all aspects (be it internal reporting or shaping sharp well thought out proposals/pitch to customers)
Engage with industry leaders, peers, and potential partners to develop new opportunities for our STS offerings
Present at conferences our technologies
Undertake screening of early-stage opportunities to determine viability to progress the opportunity to the project sales team
Engage with the project sales to team to support the development of the pursuit strategy
Increase the market visibility of our STS offerings
Develop the team reporting to this role to support the overall STS business objectives
Develop a strategic plan to continue to grow market share within the renewable fuels, plastics circularity, and carbon capture markets
MUST HAVE:
Bachelor's degree
Minimum 10 years of business development experience
WE VALUE:
Broad knowledge of refining, petrochemical and/or gas processing technologies (including carbon capture and hydrogen production technologies)
Experience in Business Development with a hunter’s attitude
Financial awareness of the levers that can be applied to make project feasible
Efficient communicator, with a high level of interpersonal skills, ability to present to audiences
Fast thinker, ability to process & connect disparate data to create a well-articulated pitch
Experience navigating complex sales cycle and negotiations
Customer obsession a must
Excellent storyteller, takes ownership, simplifies problem and is curious to learn
Customer engagement at senior levels; building long-term strategic and executive relationships
Ambitious, self-motivated, hardworking, results orientated, problem solver with a positive outlook and a clear focus on driving profit
Cross selling and consultative selling - experience with collaborating across both client and own organization to drive a One-Honeywell approach
Willingness to travel globally (>30 %)

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job brief
We are looking for an Account Manager to create long-term, trusting relationships with our customers. The Account Manager’s role is to oversee a portfolio of assigned customers, develop new business from existing clients and actively seek new sales opportunities.
What does an Account Manager do?
Account management responsibilities include developing strong relationships with customers, connecting with key business executives and stakeholders and preparing sales reports. Account Managers also answer client queries and identify new business opportunities among existing customers. In this role, you will liaise with cross-functional internal teams (including Customer Service and Product Development departments) to improve the entire customer experience. This position may require occasional travel.
If you are familiar with account management software (CRM), have a flair for client communication and understand consumer behavior, we’d like to meet you. Ideally, candidates for this role will know how to meet ambitious individual and team-wide sales quotas.
Ultimately, a successful Account Manager should collaborate with our sales team to achieve quotas while keeping our clients satisfied and engaged with our products and services in the long-run.
Responsibilities
Serve as the lead point of contact for all customer account management matters
Build and maintain strong, long-lasting client relationships
Negotiate contracts and close agreements to maximize profits
Develop trusted advisor relationships with key accounts, customer stakeholders and executive sponsors
Ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to customer needs and objectives
Clearly communicate the progress of monthly/quarterly initiatives to internal and external stakeholders
Develop new business with existing clients and/or identify areas of improvement to meet sales quotas
Forecast and track key account metrics (e.g. quarterly sales results and annual forecasts)
Prepare reports on account status
Collaborate with sales team to identify and grow opportunities within territory
Assist with challenging client requests or issue escalations as needed
Requirements and skills
Proven work experience as an Account Manager, Key Account Manager, Sales Account Manager, Junior Account Manager or relevant role
Demonstrable ability to communicate, present and influence key stakeholders at all levels of an organization, including executive and C-level
Solid experience with CRM software (e.g. Salesforce, Zoho CRM or HubSpot) and MS Office (particularly MS Excel)
Experience delivering client-focused solutions to customer needs
Proven ability to juggle multiple account management projects at a time, while maintaining sharp attention to detail
Excellent listening, negotiation and presentation abilities
Strong verbal and written communication skills
BA/BS degree in Business Administration, Sales or relevant field

Depend Electronics is a worldwide supplier and exporter of electronic components, specializing in CPU, Memory, PC/Service Peripherals, LCD panels, Active and Passive components. Join us in a dynamic and innovative environment where your passion and contributions can make a difference. Job Title: Sales Account Manager

What You’ll Do (Responsibilities and Duties):

Seek out potential clients, nurturing relationships with OEMs, EMS, CEMs and end-user clients to achieve sales targets.
Establish strategic procurement partnerships with global electronic product manufacturers through a combination of email correspondence, phone communication, and in-person meetings.

Roles & Responsibilities
Develop, maintain and measure our organisation’s world-wide activity with your customer(s). Manage all aspects of our relationship to grow revenue and deliver exceptional customer service, including local and global alignment with our execution teams and the customer(s).

JOB EXPECTATIONS & KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Dedicate yourself to the success of our organisation and the customer using ethical business practices, personal commitment, passion, sacrifice and an obsession with the fundamentals of running the business.
Create and communicate a global strategic business plan in alignment with the customers’ and our organisation goals.
Penetrate customers’ organization structure at all levels, developing relationships beyond the main point of contact at all locations.
Focus on product & GEO diversification by owning, being accountable for, and management of your sales pipeline to ensure you deliver revenue growth for our organisation.
Improve your personal knowledge of your customers’ supply chain and industry, their financial objectives, and general business goals in order to continually offer value add services. Create a network diagram to support you on this endeavor.
Initiate value add solutions based on our organisation service offerings and technology.
Establish systems requirements (such as EDI) to better improve our customer connectivity and overall customer service.
Ensure global visibility and collaboration across our organisation network (strategic updates, KPI’s, service deliverables and initiatives).
Follow our established bid process and engage key stakeholders so they are aware of, and actively supporting your efforts.
Create and deliver effective customer business reviews with emphasis placed on how our organisation can support customers with achieving their goals and initiatives.
Establish and monitor performance standards according to agreed KPI’s.
Ensure customer expectations are clearly documented (through SharePoint or Customer SOP) and communicated effectively.
Highlight and escalate customers at risk.
Ensure yields are managed and in line with company expectations with regular review through BI portal (LAM accounts).
Ensure rates are kept up to date and communicated effectively to operations and customer either through customer SOP or SharePoint.
Ensure customer is properly set up in CRM & customer account according to CHQ expectations.
Document all meetings, opportunities and any other customer related information in CRM; and ensure data is accurate and consistent at all times.
Achieve and maintain acceptable scoring of related AM measurements including the engagement of corrective measures when applicable.
Travel when necessary.
Regular 1:1 meetings with CRDM with expectations review

University or equivalent business qualifications
Minimum 3 years relevant industry experience
Proven work experience in business development
Proficient in MS Office and CRM software
Ability to communicate up and down management hierarchy with equal effectiveness
Strong presentation skills
Strong analytical skills
Proven problem solving and interpersonal skill
Charismatic with an ability to connect

title: Manager Customer Success
company_info: VMware is the leader in virtualization and cloud infrastructure solutions that enable our more than 500,000 enterprise and mid-market customers to thrive in the Cloud Era by simplifying, automating and transforming the way they build, deliver and consume IT. We empower our customers by radically simplifying IT through virtualization software with a focus on three core missions: End-User Computing (EUC), Hybrid Cloud and Software-Defined Data Center (SDDC). Join our community – instigators of innovation and transformers of technology – as we envision and create what’s next in IT. Get connected to an engine of opportunity fueled by the transformative products and solutions we bring to market, the passion and trust we inspire in our customers, and our collaborative drive to imagine, define and deliver the future of IT. With 13,000+ employees and 50+ locations worldwide, we are passionately driven to make an impact while contributing back to the community. Ranked on the Forbes 100 Most Innovative Companies in the World list. Learn more at vmware.com/careers today.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?
Does helping organizations achieve their business goals through technology inspire you? If it does, we have the perfect job opportunity for you!
As the manager of the Customer Success Technical Account Manager (TAM) team, you will have the pleasure of using your leadership, communication, and collaboration skills to lead your team and help our customers achieve their full potential through the adoption of VMware's technology.
Upon joining our Customer Success Technical Account Management team, you can bring your authentic self to work and use your skills to make an impact and drive change for our team, customers, products, and company.
In the Manager TAM role, no day is the same, and you will never be bored! You will interact daily with your team and will be able to make a real impact on their success as an individual. TAMs find nothing more satisfying than being challenged and being able to turn challenges into positive outcomes.

Success in the Role: What are the performance outcomes over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?
During the first year, you will be onboard into the manager role and work with your assigned team.
The first thing that you will achieve is completing a well-organized five-week onboarding plan that will be prepared for you.Three months after engaging with your team and key stakeholders, you will be able to articulate their long-term and short-term goals and how they connect to the bigger picture of their business — identifying the gaps that need to be resolved and working on a structured plan of attack.
You will start to establish a long-term relationship with your key stakeholders.
You will educate sales teams on the value of having TAMs in their accounts.
Between six to eleven months from your joining date, you can start to shape the team to meet any change in market demands.
The Work: What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing regularly?
As part of the management team of the Customer Success TAM team, you will help shape the team's future. Your skills and responsibilities will include.
Recruit, manage, mentor and retain a high-performing technical team by promoting growth in capabilities and careers while prioritizing diversity, inclusion, and excellence.
Take ownership of all aspects of the post-sales customer experience, ensuring elevated levels of customer satisfaction and prominent levels of renewals. Taking the initiative to continuously listen to customers and improve the customer experience every quarter. Inspire the team to advise our customers and act as an advocate to help our customers build and execute impactful plans that deliver phenomenally successful business outcomes, resulting in customer loyalty, increased adoption of VMware solutions and maintaining a high NPS (Net Promoter Score).
Optimize the commercial success and growth of the KOREA TAM team through contribution to the operational plan for the business, assisting in managing the forecast for bookings, revenue, margin, customer NPS, renewals and employee NPS and forward planning of resources.
Develop and cultivate strategic relationships with all stakeholders within your assigned territory - customers, partners and internally within VMware. Evangelize the business value of VMware Customer Success Technical Accounts Management services in all quarters.
Develop best practices and assets based on learnings from customer engagements to support initiatives to scale through partners and accelerate technological transformation.
Expertise with VMware’s core stack of products (vCenter, vSphere, ESXi, etc.)
Have VMware Certified Professional Certification (VCP) 5 or greater certification would be preferred
What is the leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like?
This role is report directly into the Director, Customer Success TAM (SEAK). The Director, Customer Success TAM reports to the Senior Director Customer Success TAM, APJ.

Where is this role located?
Flexible: The role is considered flexible and will be a mix of working from a local VMware office and remote depending on your preferences and the arrangements determined with your future manager.

TDCX helps clients, including many of the world’s best brands, achieve their customer experience aspirations by harnessing technology, human intelligence, and our global footprint. We serve clients in fintech, gaming, technology, home sharing and travel, digital advertising and social media, streaming, and e-commerce. description:

#BeMore
Do you aspire for a rewarding career that lets you do more and achieve more? Unleash your full potential at work with TDCX, an award-winning and fast-growing BPO company.
Work with the world’s most loved brands and be with awesome, diverse people. Be home, belong, and start your journey to #BeMore!

Join a global company, winner of hundreds of industry awards
What is your mission?
You’ll help us deliver excellent service to our partner brands by performing these tasks:
Contacting new and existing clients (Agencies or Advertisers) via telephone, chat and email on a daily basis, identifying sales opportunities and providing these businesses with the best solution for their business goal.

Perform other duties and responsibilities that may be assigned to you by the management within your category of employment in the organization and for the effective implementation, maintenance and continual improvement of the Quality Management System of TDCX.
Who are we looking for?
Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's Degree in any field.
Preferably with 2 years of working experience in the related field is ideal for this position.
Strong time management skills and motivation to exceed expectations.
Business development, sales account management or consultative selling experience is a plus.
Excellent communication skills: verbal, written, listening skills.
Self-starter who can meet deadlines and enjoys working in a competitive inside sales environment, comfortable working with computers and multiple systems.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and the language of the supporting market such as Japanese to support customer in Japan.
Who is TDCX?
TDCX (NYSE: TDCX) provides transformative digital CX solutions, enabling world-leading and disruptive brands to acquire new customers, build customer loyalty, and protect their online communities.
TDCX helps clients, including many of the world’s best brands, achieve their customer experience aspirations by haressing technology, human intelligence, and our global footprint. We serve clients in fintech, gaming, technology, home sharing and travel, digital advertising and social media, streaming, and e-commerce. Our expertise and strong footprint in Asia have made us a trusted partner for clients, particularly high-growth, new economy companies looking to tap the region’s growth potential.
We pride ourselves on discovering and employing the best professionals to join us as we transform the outsourced CX industry. Our commitment to #BeMore for our people, our clients, and our community has led to us winning several hundreds of industry awards, including being one of the best companies to work for in Asia.
From our first-rate workspaces, above-industry-average compensation packages, career opportunities, to our workplace perks, find out what else is in store when you embark on a career with TDCX.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Objectives of the position:

The Product Manager is responsible for design, development, implementation, and analysis of products. Performs routine engineering design tasks using standard techniques. Fair knowledge of
cable and components applications.

Key Responsibilities

• Planning and evaluating new projects, consulting with other engineers and management as necessary.
• Review new product plans and make recommendations for material selection, based on design objectives such as strength, weight, heat resistance, electrical conductivity, and cost.
• Work with account managers, sales, production and engineers to establish cost estimates and production standards.
• Identifies process bottlenecks and devises solutions to resolve.
• Prepare technical drawings to ensure that installation and operations conform to standards and customer requirements. Where applicable.
• Optimizes productivity in both the engineering and production areas by designing, implementing and testing new procedures.
• Contributes to the teams’ efforts by successfully completing related tasks as needed.

Skills & Qualification

• Analytical skills for troubleshooting designs that are not working as planned and finding answers that work by asking the right questions and testing options.
• Strong written and verbal communication skills to effectively explain details of the process and findings to groups of all skillsets.
• Interpersonal skills to develop strong and positive working relationships with the engineering team and all employees in the production process.
• Strong technical knowledge and critical thinking
• Bachelor’s degree in Engineering. Electrical or Electronics preferred.
• 5 years of engineering experience preferred.
• Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) systems.

Reviewing internal operational policies and procedures to ensure they are continuously updated in line with industry standards and/or clients expectations.
Lead HR advisory initiatives for outsource clients as the go-to HR subject matter expert.
Train new employees on company policies and procedures and understand InCorp’s systems.
Working closely with the HR team to manage the learning needs of the team.
Assigning work tasks to employees based on their job description, experience level and skill set.
Managing with payroll team to ensure payroll records are accurate.
Managing employee performance through regular meetings and performance evaluations.

Minimum 7 to 10 years of relevant payroll processing and statutory compliance experience for Singapore at a managerial level.

Excellent communication skills, written and verbal and ability to liaise effectively with various stakeholders.

Team attitude and ability to work with a variety of skillsets and autonomously.
Process an analytical and inquisitive mindset.

title: Country Manager
company_info: Dynata (ex-SSI / Research Now) is one of the world’s leading providers of first-party data contributed by consumers and business professionals. With a reach that encompasses 60+ million people globally and an extensive library of individual profile attributes collected through surveys, Dynata is the cornerstone for precise, trustworthy quality data. The company has built innovative data services and solutions around its core first-party data offering to bring the voice of the customer to the entire marketing spectrum, from market research to marketing and advertising. Dynata serves nearly 6,000 market research agencies, media and advertising agencies, consulting and investment firms, and healthcare and corporate customers in North America, South America, Europe, and Asia-Pacific.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Country Manager leads the SEA sales team and is a part of the regional APAC management team. This is a high visibility role and will be the face of the organization within the market. In this role, you will be working with a team of Account Directors and Managers to drive plans around the development and implementation of sales strategies and practices for the SEA market to meet or exceed the sales targets. To be successful in this role, you will have experience working with high-touch clients, a solid understanding of market research, and have a flair for team management. You
will be highly motivated to proactively drive revenue from key clients within the assigned territory, look at opportunities to up-sell/cross-sell products, and lead the team in a consistent and professional manner. Additionally, you will also offer insightful and strategic solutions to business objectives while developing knowledge of client sectors, business, industry issues, products, and solutions.

These include the following. Other duties may be assigned at the discretion of
management in the context of the role:
Deliver sales targets and meet KPI's through the management of a mixed portfolio of new business and existing clients
Proactively drive revenue from previously unknown or under leveraged sources
Actively source opportunities through multiple avenues including research and networking.
Implement strategic account management and key account planning programs; Engage in an open dialogue with Dynata’s strategic clients through meetings and annual relationship surveys
Prepare a wide range of written proposals including full costing quotations
Offer insightful and strategic solutions to business objectives
Support the implementation of marketing programs, new product rollouts and other initiatives
Develop knowledge of client sectors, business, industry issues, products, and solutions
Ability to offer accurate forecasting for the business at a weekly/quarterly basis
Maintain strong Industry presence and represent the company at events, roadshows, etc.
Requirements:

A successful track record in Sales including business development, ideally within a consultative environment
Prior management experience and the ability to do business plans
Strong academic background & 10+ years of professional work experience
An understanding of the online marketing Research industry (preferable but not essential)
Excellent communication skills
Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage your time effectively prioritizing tasks to meet a range of tight deadlines
Excellent attention to detail
The ability to communicate effectively to both internal and external stakeholders
Be a proactive and motivated 'go getter' who thrives in a sales environment
Our Company Values
Focus on Solutions, not problems
Work hard, play hard
Be the best
Let integrity be your guide
Stay one step ahead
What we can offer:

Flexible working arrangements to suit your lifestyle needs
Wellness perks such as Insurance, free flu vaccinations, counseling services, health advice, etc.
Career Development with global opportunities
A culture of appreciation with chances to give and receive appreciation from peers all over the world through our internal recognition program DYNAMO
Collaborative and supportive team environment with social events all year round
Access to development courses and additional training from our internal L&D portal
GIVE (Get Involved, Volunteer, Engage) day - a day of volunteering to give back to your local community in a cause of your choosing
Sports sponsorship covering all or part of the joining cost including Dynata merchandise so you can rep us proudly during the event
Education Assistance to enhance your professional and personal growth
Central and convenient office location within walking distance to public transport
Diversity and Inclusion initiative where we take strides each day to continue to invest in ensuring our panels and team are diverse and guide clients on ways to be more inclusive in their research.
Being part of a globally recognized brand leader in Market Research, gaining access to insights, modern technology, and information about the industry and our 5000+ clients
At Dynata, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. We are committed to an inclusive work culture for all our employees. Accommodation by request can be made for all aspects of the selection process. Dynata is also an affirmative action employer and welcomes and encourages applications from people regardless of age, disability, race, sex, intersex status, gender identity, sexual orientation, and breastfeeding status.

title: Sales Consumption Excellence Manager
company_info: Microsoft (Nasdaq “MSFT” @Microsoft) is the leading platform and productivity company for the mobile-first, cloud-first world, and its mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. For news about Microsoft in Singapore, join the conversation on Twitter. Follow us at @Microsoft_SG.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
With over 17,000 employees worldwide, the Microsoft Customer Experience & Success (CE&S) organization is responsible for the strategy, design, and implementation of Microsoft’s end-to-end customer experience. Come join CE&S and help us build a future where customers come to us not only because we provide industry-leading products and services, but also because we provide a differentiated and connected customer experience.
International Customer Success Unit (iCSU) brings scale, agility, and cross solution coverage to our largest, most strategic Global Account customers in their international downstream locations outside of headquarters. We operate out of key geographic locations around the world enabling global execution of our customer’s digital transformation strategies. We bring a seamless customer experience that crosses functional and geographic boundaries empowering customers to realize the business value of their investments in our technology.
iCSU is looking for a consumption sales excellence lead with a passion for driving consumption and usage and realizing Value-Based Delivery (VBD) of Unified Support business for customers. In this position you are responsible for landing annual fiscal year strategies and driving consumption execution excellence throughout the fiscal year for one of the three key time zones, Americas, Asia and EMEA. You will work closely with a time zone Customer Success Lead and a team of Cloud Solution Architects (CSAs), Customer Success Account Managers (CSAMs) and managers in the time zone while leveraging business insights, RoB, annual planning processes from the iCSU central consumption execellence and business planning team for a consistent approach of execution across time zones.
This role is flexible in that you can work up to 100% from home.
Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
Responsibilities
Business Partnership and Support
Drives consumption growth through account or business planning. Analyzes the outlook and leverages business insights to benchmark performance and make suggestions on current and future actions based on key drivers, opportunities, and/or risks. Supports the integration, alignment, and/or execution on the defined actions within iCSU.
Lead in-time-zone territory planning and quota setting, and customer transition/”red carpet” process, and enable fast start of the fiscal year.
As primary orchestrator of the Account/Portfolio Partner Business Planning. Coaches managers and sellers on account/portfolio/partner business planning fundamentals, habits, and plan quality. Contributes to reinforcement and review of quality plans within the segment/region.
Maintains and/or defines a predictable rhythm of the Business (RoB) in collaboration with peers and/or leadership. Contributes to RoB activities to enforce great discipline and ensure quality outcome delivery. Provides business insights and recommendations to effect positive changes. Identifies opportunities to streamline and improve the RoB cadence within the supported segment/region.
Advises and contributes to consumption and Support delivery teams on consumption and Support delivery motions/strategies for opportunity management. Contributes to operationalizing prioritized VBD. Identifies opportunities to generate new consumption pipeline and accelerate the closing of existing opportunities (Job 1 and Job 2 consumption pipeline discipline).
Sales Coaching for Growth and Transformation
Coaches and builds relationships with consumption and Support delivery team on executing key priorities. Engages consumption and Support delivery team to become more effective coaches to their sellers. Helps consumption and Support delivery team achieve increased individual and team capability, employee satisfaction, and collaborative selling efforts. May contribute to coaching on large deal pursuit.
Improves awareness and clarity of Corporate or TimeZone programs among consumption and Support delivery teams and managers. Intakes and contributes to adopting plans to create new habits among consumption and Support delivery teams or partners.
Contributes to optimizing consumption and Support delivery team processes and capabilities within the supported segment. Assesses customer/partner needs and applies methodologies and resources to transform seller capabilities, sales processes, and/or partner engagement processes.
Driving Consumption & Support Delivery Process Discipline
Contributes to analytics on key consumption and Support delivery drivers. Integrates findings from data analysis. Leverages reporting and analytical capabilities to generate data-based insights and enable visibility into consumption and forecast for CSAs, CSAMs, managers and leaders, or partners.
Instills consumption and Support delivery process discipline, adherence to standards and excellence in execution, or pipeline health. Holds managers accountable for account plan quality and completeness. Helps ensure consistency and excellence in the consumption and Support delivery process in the time zone. Shares best practices within their team.
Acts as a subject matter expert to advocate and support effective and rigorous usage of common and/or new processes and tools developed for the wider business to improve internal and external communications and engagements. Consolidates input from the time zone into the feedback loop. Communicates feedback to engineer/partner teams on tools.
Supporting Executive Capacity
Supports CSU leader capacity as a senior leader. Advises on and contributes to various aspects of business management (e.g., employee engagement, resource allocation, change management, building high-performing teams) in collaboration with leadership and cross-functional teams. Represents the segment as an internal advocate and an extension of the segment leadership.
Other
Embody our culture and values
Qualifications
Required/Minimum Qualifications
4+ years experience in sales/consumption/Support delivery operations/management, account or portfolio management, program management, business development, marketing, consulting, or a related field
OR equivalent experience.
3+ years of experience using data to drive business outcomes or inform business decisions.
3+ years of experience managing relationships with stakeholders, clients, and/or customers.
Additional or Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in a related field.
3+ years managing projects, including planning, managing timelines, and tracking progress, and/or change management experience.
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

title: Cohort Manager, Cloud Academy, GTM Google Cloud, Singapore (OR Sydney, Bangalore, Gurgaon)
company_info: GOOGLE ASIA PACIFIC PTE. LTD.
address: Google Asia Pacific, Singapore, 70 Pasir Panjang Road 117371
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
PRODUCT AREA
Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
JOB DESCRIPTION
Google Cloud Academy aims to empower early career professionals through immersive experiences, enabling talent to excel in technical and non-technical customer-facing roles. We seek a visionary Googler to launch the program in JAPAC. This individual will be responsible for shaping the program's design, raising regional awareness, delivering training, hiring and managing early career (graduate) professionals. The Cohort Manager will support both the technical cohort (Pre-Sales Engineers, Customer Engineers) and the non-technical cohort (Sales, Business Development). Join us, if you are passionate about innovation and are eager to contribute to the development of top-tier talent.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Create a site location strategy in JAPAC, working with senior regional leadership (Director+) in both technical and non-technical domains, staffing, strategy, and operations, to accomplish program objectives.
Establish collaborative relationships with internal teams and stakeholders worldwide to localize and optimize content and materials, ensuring their effectiveness and alignment with success criteria.
Design and implement JAPAC-specific programming for our intensive training curriculum, including securing mentors for rotations and effectively managing performance and progress of Cloud Academy residents throughout their training schedule.

Le Pub was created by combining the renowned Publicis Italy (“#1 Creative Agency in World” - Adweek 2021, “#2 Creative Agency in the World” at Cannes 2021, “Most Effective Ad in the world” – Kantar 2021) & best-in-class data, media and technology expertise from Publicis Amsterdam. We believe that brands can no longer merely communicate with consumers and must now earn their place in people’s daily lives. Stated differently – it’s about helping brands deliver real value (rather than messages). That’s why Le Pub is obsessed with creating innovative experiences that matter enough to “live in culture”. Fueled by rich global data and powered by world-class creativity - Le Pub is where brands meet culture.

The most creative agency in the world
https://www.publicis.it/index.php/awards/

Have a look at the work:
https://www.publicis.it/index.php/portfolio/

What they say about us:
https://www.publicis.it/index.php/category/news-en/

Account management is the key point of contact for the clients on the day to day, overseeing project delivery at timely manner, on budget and enable highest standard of strategic thinking and creative output.

Expectations of an Account Manager / Senior Account Manager

● Manages global campaign & regional campaigns
● Acts as the first point of contact for client questions and requests on particular project. Translate the business and client needs into actionable plan for internal team across planning, creative and production department.
● Builds and maintains relationships with clients, often through regular face-to-face contact and meetings
● Partners with Planners to develop and implement highly interactive strategic responses for the brand’s business and communications needs
● Problem-solves high-level account and production issues and knows when to involve their supervisor
● Generate accurate reports on the status of existing accounts and new business
● Leads presentations with clients
● Manages a budget and delivery timing for projects
● Always on a look out for opportunities to cross-sell within the Groupe
● Committed to constantly improving our work and how we work
● Maintains a sense of discretion and professionalism, representing the Groupe

Other requirements

● Required 5 years of account/ digital/ production experience in a creative advertising agency
● Deep understanding of digital production steps and processes – responsible for high-level digital communication with clients
● Capable of writing thoughtful interactive communication strategy presentations, highlighting current trends in digital media, technology and advertising that may be utilized to achieve a client’s business outcomes
● Lives the interactive ecosystem (truly born of Digital), understands how social, mobile, experiential, search, etc, all co-exist
● Able to effectively interpret and lead regarding measurement reporting, whether regarding standard or rich media advertising or social
● Rallies behind interactive briefs and pushes clients and creatives to explore new interactive projects
● Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines in a fast-paced creative environment
● Effective negotiation and problem-solving skills
● Strong financial understanding of budgeting, estimating and agency profitability
● A track record of gaining trust and respect by consistently demonstrating sound critical thinking skills and maintaining composure in stressful situations
● Exceptional written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate with all levels of employees
● Highly organized with a keen sense of attention to detail
● Exceptional initiative and follow-through skills

title: Account Manager, Healthcare

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
If you have received tertiary training in the domain of biological sciences, biomedical sciences, life sciences or pharmacy, our current team of healthcare account managers are looking forward to you joining the flock in coupling your bioscience knowledge with digital marketing know-how. Read on to find out more!
Account Manager - Healthcare
The Account Manager will be responsible for managing and implementing digital transformation strategies aligned with our clients' business goals. This person will be the primary point of contact with clients and will be responsible for their projects. He/She will need to foster a strong working relationship internally with the creative/production team as well as externally with clients on the approval of campaigns and contents. The ideal candidate has to be agile, disciplined, highly motivated and has a native understanding of digital resources to deliver the best for the clients. To be successful in this role, the candidate must build strong and strategic partnerships with healthcare providers whose accounts are under his/her management – from clinicians and pharmacists to business unit managers and marketing managers alike.
Training will be provided for specific skillsets on digital advertising strategies as well as the understanding of key performance metrics.
Responsibilities and Duties
Manage pharmaceutical, medical and healthcare clients and liaise with internal and external stakeholders, including key opinion leaders on specific therapeutic areas
Forge strong relationships with clients and be the primary point of contact for key activities
Collaborate with internal content production teams to generate digital assets including video, graphics, ad copy, and landing page URLs in order to create and deliver best-in-class social media and content-driven campaigns for our clients
Point of liaison with clients on approval of campaigns and content; understanding their changing needs and adapting our approach to social media management for them accordingly
Manage timelines, content calendars and project-manage marketing campaigns
Deep-dive into social media analytics in order to gather actionable insights and generate monthly reports
Stay up-to-date on industry changes to ensure our clients are always ahead of the curve on digital and social
Qualifications and Skills
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Pharmacy, Science or related scientific discipline
At least 2-3 years of prior experience in pharmaceutical or healthcare industry
Ability to conceptualise medical content and the analysis of data from clinical papers, assimilating them into slide presentations or reports
Basic to Intermediate understanding of digital and social media platforms, their features and audiences
Knowledge of Facebook Ad Manager and experience in running ad campaigns is a bonus
Superior collaboration and teamwork skills; experience working with cross-functional teams
Project management experience and adaptability: Ability to re-prioritise while operating within a fast paced environment, while continuously maintaining attention to detail, establishing priorities and meeting deadlines
Intermediate level in MS Office software (Excel, Powerpoint) and/or Google for Work products (Google Analytics, Sheets, Slides)
Medical Channel Asia
MCA is the fastest growing health platform focused on credible Asian-centric healthcare information. Present on multiple social media and digital platforms with its content catered to the Asian population covering wellness, health and fitness topics, its rapidly growing readership and following stands at over 1 million video views on Youtube, over 5 million views on Tiktok and over 20 million reach on Facebook and Instagram.

As Account Manager, the role holds responsibility for developing, implementing and delivering B-F’s Global Travel Retail (GTR) strategy, process and plans through effective key account management for the Southeast Asia region.
Key tasks will include managing customer negotiations, securing profitable listings, building broad and deep customer relationships, optimizing merchandising placement and coordinating promotional activities. The role will collaborate with Global Travel Retail and local management teams to support the expansion and growth of the Southeast Asia GTR channel, evaluate market conditions, develop and implement marketing strategies and sales plans. Continue an increasingly global approach to key account management with key customers, through close collaboration with the Account Managers in other countries where the customers operate
Build, develop and grow dynamic and meaningful relationships with travel retail operators in order to interpret customer strategy, gain alignment, and achieve best in class partnership

Work with GTR and brand teams to execute agreed brand plans and budgets to achieve regional goals in the assigned territory
Secure optimal retail brand exposure and dominate at the point of purchase, proactively identify profitable growth opportunities for the B-F spirits portfolio through merchandising and promotional activities, additional store activities, training, incentivizing, rewarding and influencing

title: Key Account Manager
company_info: We are a team of passionate ecommerce experts, dedicated to enabling our brand and seller partners to capture the immense online opportunity in South East Asia. Intrepid enables its brand and seller partners to increase their ecommerce sales by offering store management and online marketing services. We also offer an end-to-end service ranging from photoshooting to integration with third-party fulfillment and logistics providers. With operations in Singapore, Vietnam, Thailand, Philippines, Indonesia, and Malaysia – we aim to become the leading ecommerce service provider in South East Asia.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Intrepid
Intrepid Group (www.intrepid.asia), an Ascential company (https://www.ascential.com/), is a leading regional Digital and Ecommerce Services Provider in South East Asia. We offer end-to-end omni-channel ecommerce management, a wide range of Digital Marketing Services and advanced Insights & Analytics, all powered by state of the art inhouse Technology to our client base of leading international brands across >10 marketplaces and multiple social platforms in all 6 SEA countries. Brands love our regional presence, our excellent pro-active ecommerce service which is enabled by our strong team, and our advanced marketing and tech capabilities.
We are part of Ascential (https://www.ascential.com), a global leader in information, analytics and eCommerce optimization. Together with Ascential, Intrepid is growing rapidly, with many exciting opportunities to work with leading brands and ecommerce platforms across multiple categories. By joining us, you’ll get to experience what it takes to drive a successful ecommerce business end to end.
The Role
A Key Account Manager is the liaison officer between Intrepid, its clients, and the platforms the client is selling on. He/She oversees the Intrepid-client relationship, determines opportunities, and identifies process improvements to grow their online sales revenue and to ensure Intrepid delivers the service level agreement.
Your responsibilities will include:
Deliver & perform best on the following KPIs for brand/seller partners, through internal & external coordination with concerned departments:
Content management & optimization
Campaign strategies & execution
Chat response representation of the brand/seller
Operations capacity and process implementation
Progressive revenue trend and overall online sales performance
Foster client relationships; work with sales and marketing teams and other support teams available
Design sales growth proposals; handle client communications and prepare client reports; and communicate client agendas to other staff members
Ensure clients’ needs are met and their voices are heard while coordinating with others and fulfilling the contractual day-to-day duties
Positive client NPS
Who we look for - the ideal profile:
Fluent in English
Experience with business fundamentals
Minimum 2 years of eCommerce background preferably from a brand/platforms/enablers industry
Proactive self-starter who understands Intrepid vision & mission and can be the company’s best service ambassador
Excellent negotiation skills
Strong interpersonal skills (empathy & flexibility)
Proficient in excel and powerpoint
What we offer:
Excellent and competitive compensation package
Professional and open international working environment – culturally integrating the best of all cultures to take the best of each and ensure we build an energetic, commercial, and fun working atmosphere.
You are one of the pioneers of a new and cutting edge Intrepid product underpinned by strong tech. You have a key position in the Intrepid Insights team working on a unique product solving complex data challenges.
Ample opportunity for personal and professional development, both on the job and through regular training (Ecommerce topics, technical skills, soft skills and leadership training) made available on our proprietary learning platform Intrepid University
You will work with many brilliant co-workers who are movers and shakers of the industry, as well as with leading brand and ecosystem partners across all categories to shape their presence across all ecommerce platforms in the years to come, and will have a broad view on the latest developments in the South East Asian e-commerce ecosystem
Note: we will not be accepting any unsolicited resumes or CVs from headhunting or recruitment agencies at this point. Any CVs or profiles shared with us will not be entertained, and in the event of dispute, Intrepid will not be liable for any material compensation to third parties

title: Channel Account Manager (IT Industry)
company_info: ACA Pacific Technology is an established IT Marketing and Value-Added Distribution Company since 1986. Serving the Asia-Pacific region for more than 20 years, our forte is in selecting and integrating the "Best-of-Breed" software and hardware to meet changing business dynamics. With our committment to drive business values to our partners, ACA provides unparallel levels of channel sales and marketing support and constantly engages the world's top IT manufacturers and developers in the technology arena. Our product and services offering includes; - Business and Imaging Solutions - Design Automation Solutions - Media and Entertainment Solutions - Creative Finishing Solutions - Enterprise Security and Networking Solutions - Enterprise Storage and Backup Solutions - Authorized and Certified Training Centers Today, ACA continues to be a leading dstributor of IT supplies in Asia, with an extensive network of over 800 trained and certified channel partners offering an extensive range of integrated solutions, products and professional services in Singapore, Australia, Malaysia, Indonesia and Thailand.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:
We are seeking a Channel Account Manager to join our dynamic team in the fast-paced IT industry. As a Channel Account Manager, you will play a vital role in establishing and nurturing strong relationships with our channel partners to drive sales, increase market share, and achieve business objectives. Your focus will be on managing and expanding our channel network to maximize revenue and create mutually beneficial partnerships.

Responsibilities:
1. Channel Partner Management:
o Develop and maintain strategic relationships with existing channel partners, such as value-added resellers (VARs), system integrators, and distributors.

o Collaborate with partners to align business goals, establish joint business plans, and drive mutual growth.

o Provide regular training, enablement, and support to partners to enhance their product knowledge and capabilities.

2. Sales and Revenue Generation:
o Work closely with channel partners to identify sales opportunities, develop sales pipelines, and close deals.

o Collaborate with internal sales teams to ensure effective lead management and seamless handover of opportunities.

3. Channel Development and Expansion:
o Identify and recruit new channel partners to expand market reach and coverage.

o Conduct thorough evaluations to assess potential partners, considering their expertise, market presence, and alignment with company values.

o Provide ongoing support and resources to enable partners to effectively promote and sell the company's IT products and solutions.

4. Collaboration and Communication:
o Foster strong cross-functional relationships with internal teams, including sales, marketing, product management, and support.

o Collaborate with marketing teams to develop channel-specific marketing campaigns, collateral, and promotional materials.

o Communicate regularly with channel partners to provide updates, share information, and promptly address any concerns or issues.

o Represent the company at industry events, trade shows, and conferences to enhance brand visibility and strengthen partner relationships.

Requirements:
· Experience in a Sales Role or similar role within the IT industry is advantageous.

· Demonstrated track record of achieving sales targets and driving revenue growth through channel partnerships.

· Strong understanding of channel management strategies, partner ecosystems, and indirect sales models in the IT industry.

· Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and influence at all levels.

· Solid negotiation and problem-solving abilities to address partner challenges and resolve conflicts.

· Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret market data, identify trends, and make data-driven decisions.

· Proactive and results-oriented, with a strong sense of ownership and accountability.

· Familiarity with IT products, solutions, and industry trends.

· Willingness to travel as needed to meet with partners, attend industry events, and visit customers.

Join our innovative team and be part of the IT industry's transformation. Apply now and contribute to our success as a Channel Account Manager.

Fresh Graduates are welcome to apply.

Roles & Responsibilities
Direct Search Global is working with one of the leading shipping agency service providers to fill the role of Key Account Manager in Singapore.

Why this job?
In this role, you get to collaborate with supportive colleagues. They value diverse perspectives and encourage creative thinking. This company is a prominent partner in the shipping industry, offering global shipping agency services and hub solutions. You get to connect with charterers, ship managers, and ship owners/operators in local ports worldwide.

Who should apply?
The suitable candidate must be service-oriented and a forward-thinking innovator who has a deep passion for the maritime industry. As the Key Account Manager, your primary responsibility is to support the company Client Management to ensure the implementation and delivery of client requirements. You will work closely with Client Management, Global and Regional Hubs to manage day-to-day client delivery process.

Job Responsibilities:
· Ensuring a thorough understanding and proper implementation of newly agreed-upon requirements with existing clients by hub and regional centers.
· Cultivating and maintaining strong commercial relationships with clients.
· Proficiently comprehending and interpreting the contractual terms that govern client relationships.
· Diligently following up on meetings to ensure prompt and complete implementation of action points, with confirmation provided to the client manager.
· Tracking client performance, including: following up client-specific Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), providing monthly reports, managing system logins maintenance, ensuring that port cost templates remain current.
· Establishing new client setups in alignment with client manager/client agreements, involving: hub and system configuration, ensuring comprehension and implementation of working/financial procedures by global hub and regional centers.
· Conducting daily monitoring of initial start-up calls at both the hub and regional/local levels.
· Delivering ongoing remote training to client staff.

Job Requirements:
· Prior exposure to port agency operations and customer service.
· Preference for experience within an international hub-based setting.
· A well-organized individual with the capability to analyze and enhance processes.
· Proficient in both verbal and written communication.
· An essential team player.
· Exhibits excellent customer service attitude, including a professional telephone manner.
· Expected to adhere to all company policies and procedures.
· Highly motivated and capable of achieving defined goals and measurable accomplishments.
· Possess outstanding time management skills, enabling you to manage multiple client accounts effectively.
· Possess proficient IT skills and the ability to swiftly grasp new operating systems.
· Cultivate positive business relationships with clients.
· Exhibit the ability to adhere to stringent deadlines and achieve set targets.
· Show a willingness to investigate and resolve inquiries, whether they arise internally or externally.
· Maintain organized records and follow-up procedures.
· Embrace a high-level customer service mindset.
